name: Trimipramine
description: Trimipramine is a tricyclic antidepressant used primarily for the treatment of major depressive disorder.

name: Trioxasalen
description: Trioxasalen is a synthetic compound used primarily in dermatology for its photosensitizing properties.

name: Triprolidine
description: Triprolidine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms and is known for its sedative effects.

name: Triptorelin
description: Triptorelin is a synthetic gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) analog used in the treatment of hormone-sensitive conditions.

name: Trithioparamethoxy Phenylpropene
description: Trithioparamethoxy Phenylpropene is a chemical compound with potential applications in various fields, including medicinal chemistry.

name: Triticum Vulgare extract
description: Triticum Vulgare extract, derived from wheat, is often used in cosmetics and dietary supplements for its antioxidant properties.

name: Tropicamide
description: Tropicamide is a muscarinic antagonist used primarily as a mydriatic agent to dilate the pupils during eye examinations.

name: Trospium
description: Trospium is an anticholinergic medication used to treat overactive bladder by reducing urinary frequency and urgency.

name: Troxerutin
description: Troxerutin is a flavonoid used for its potential venotonic and anti-inflammatory properties, often in the treatment of chronic venous insufficiency.

name: Troxipide
description: Troxipide is a gastroprotective agent that is used to treat gastric ulcers and improve mucosal defense.

name: Trypan Blue
description: Trypan Blue is a vital dye used in cell biology to selectively stain dead cells, allowing for viability assessment.

name: Trypsin
description: Trypsin is a serine protease enzyme that breaks down proteins in the digestive system.

name: Trypsin Chymotrypsin
description: Trypsin Chymotrypsin is a combination of two proteolytic enzymes used to aid digestion and reduce inflammation.

name: Tulobuterol
description: Tulobuterol is a bronchodilator used in the treatment of respiratory conditions such as asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

name: Udenafil
description: Udenafil is a phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor used for the treatment of erectile dysfunction.

name: Ulinastatin
description: Ulinastatin is a urinary trypsin inhibitor that has anti-inflammatory properties and is used in various clinical settings.

name: Ulipristal acetate
description: Ulipristal acetate is a selective progesterone receptor modulator used primarily for the treatment of uterine fibroids and as an emergency contraceptive.

name: Umeclidinium
description: Umeclidinium is a long-acting muscarinic antagonist (LAMA) used in the management of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) as a bronchodilator.

name: Uniflexin
description: Uniflexin is a combination medication that typically includes a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) and is used for the relief of pain and inflammation.

name: Univestin
description: Univestin is a dietary supplement derived from natural sources, often marketed for its potential benefits in joint health and inflammation.

name: Uracil
description: Uracil is a pyrimidine nucleobase that is a component of RNA and is involved in the synthesis of nucleotides.

name: Urea
description: Urea is a nitrogen-containing compound produced in the liver, primarily involved in the excretion of nitrogen from the body.

name: Urofollitropin
description: Urofollitropin is a purified form of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) used in fertility treatments to stimulate ovarian follicle development.

name: Urokinase
description: Urokinase is an enzyme that helps dissolve blood clots and is used in the treatment of certain thromboembolic disorders.

name: Ursodeoxycholic Acid
description: Ursodeoxycholic acid is a bile acid used to treat certain liver diseases and gallstones by promoting bile flow and reducing cholesterol absorption.

name: Ursodeoxycholic Acid Ursodiol
description: Ursodiol is a formulation of ursodeoxycholic acid used to dissolve cholesterol gallstones and treat primary biliary cholangitis.

name: Vaccine
description: A biological preparation that provides active acquired immunity to a particular infectious disease.

name: Valacyclovir
description: An antiviral medication used to treat infections caused by certain types of viruses, including herpes simplex and varicella-zoster.

name: Valdecoxib
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that was used to relieve pain and inflammation, particularly in osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.

name: Valethamate
description: An anticholinergic drug used primarily as a muscle relaxant and to relieve spasms.

name: Valganciclovir
description: An antiviral medication used to prevent and treat cytomegalovirus (CMV) infections, particularly in immunocompromised patients.

name: Valproic Acid
description: Valproic Acid is an anticonvulsant and mood-stabilizing drug used primarily to treat epilepsy and bipolar disorder.

name: Valsartan
description: Valsartan is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.

name: Vancomycin
description: Vancomycin is an antibiotic used to treat serious bacterial infections, particularly those caused by Gram-positive bacteria.

name: Vandetanib
description: Vandetanib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor used in the treatment of medullary thyroid cancer.

name: Vardenafil
description: Vardenafil is a phosphodiesterase type 5 (PDE5) inhibitor used to treat erectile dysfunction.

name: Varenicline
description: Varenicline is a medication used to help people quit smoking by reducing withdrawal symptoms and cravings.

name: Varicella Vaccine attenuated
description: The Varicella Vaccine attenuated is a live attenuated vaccine used to prevent chickenpox.

name: Vasopressin
description: Vasopressin is a hormone that regulates water retention in the body and is used in the treatment of diabetes insipidus and certain types of shock.

name: Vecuronium
description: Vecuronium is a neuromuscular blocking agent used to induce paralysis during surgical procedures or mechanical ventilation.

name: Velpatasvir
description: Velpatasvir is an antiviral medication used in combination therapies for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus infection.

name: Venlafaxine
description: Venlafaxine is a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) used primarily to treat major depressive disorder, anxiety, and panic disorder.

name: Verapamil
description: Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker used to treat hypertension, angina, and certain heart rhythm disorders.

name: Vericiguat
description: Vericiguat is a soluble guanylate cyclase stimulator indicated for the treatment of heart failure.

name: Verteporfin
description: Verteporfin is a photosensitizing agent used in photodynamic therapy for the treatment of certain types of macular degeneration.

name: Vi Capsular Polysaccharide Of Salmonella Typhi
description: Vi Capsular Polysaccharide Of Salmonella Typhi is a component used in vaccines to provide immunity against typhoid fever.

name: Vigabatrin
description: Vigabatrin is an antiepileptic medication used primarily to treat refractory complex partial seizures and infantile spasms.

name: Vilanterol
description: Vilanterol is a long-acting beta-agonist used in combination with other medications for the treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and asthma.

name: Vilazodone
description: Vilazodone is an antidepressant used for the treatment of major depressive disorder, acting as a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor and a partial agonist at serotonin receptors.

name: Vildagliptin
description: Vildagliptin is an oral antihyperglycemic agent used in the management of type 2 diabetes mellitus, functioning as a DPP-4 inhibitor.

name: Vinblastine
description: Vinblastine is a chemotherapy medication used to treat various types of cancer, including Hodgkin's lymphoma and testicular cancer, by inhibiting cell division.

name: Vincristine
description: Vincristine is a chemotherapy medication used to treat various types of cancer, including leukemia and lymphoma, by inhibiting cell division.

name: Vinorelbine
description: Vinorelbine is a vinca alkaloid used in cancer treatment, particularly for non-small cell lung cancer and breast cancer, by disrupting the mitotic spindle.

name: Vinpocetine
description: Vinpocetine is a synthetic derivative of the periwinkle plant, often used as a dietary supplement for cognitive enhancement and improving blood flow.

name: Vitamin A
description: Vitamin A is a fat-soluble vitamin essential for vision, immune function, and skin health, found in foods like liver, fish, and dairy products.

name: Vitamin B
description: Vitamin B refers to a group of water-soluble vitamins that play important roles in cell metabolism, including B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B7, B9, and B12.

name: Vitamin B12
description: Vitamin B12, also known as cobalamin, is a water-soluble vitamin essential for red blood cell formation, neurological function, and DNA synthesis.

name: Vitamin B2
description: Vitamin B2, or riboflavin, is a water-soluble vitamin that plays a key role in energy production and the metabolism of fats, drugs, and steroids.

name: Vitamin B3
description: Vitamin B3, also known as niacin, is a water-soluble vitamin important for converting nutrients into energy and maintaining healthy skin and nerves.

name: Vitamin B6
description: Vitamin B6, or pyridoxine, is a water-soluble vitamin involved in amino acid metabolism, neurotransmitter synthesis, and the production of hemoglobin.

name: Vitamin C
description: Vitamin C, or ascorbic acid, is a water-soluble vitamin that acts as an antioxidant and is important for collagen synthesis, immune function, and iron absorption.

name: Vitamin D
description: A fat-soluble vitamin that is important for maintaining healthy bones and supporting immune function.

name: Vitamin D3
description: Also known as cholecalciferol, it is a form of vitamin D produced in the skin in response to sunlight and is crucial for calcium absorption.

name: Vitamin E
description: A fat-soluble antioxidant that helps protect cells from oxidative damage and supports immune function.

name: Vitamin K
description: A group of fat-soluble vitamins that are essential for blood clotting and bone metabolism.

name: Voglibose
description: An alpha-glucosidase inhibitor used to manage postprandial hyperglycemia in patients with type 2 diabetes.

name: Voriconazole
description: Voriconazole is an antifungal medication used to treat serious fungal infections, particularly those caused by Aspergillus species.

name: Vortioxetine
description: Vortioxetine is an antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder and is classified as a serotonin modulator and stimulator.

name: Warfarin
description: Warfarin is an anticoagulant medication used to prevent blood clots in various conditions, including atrial fibrillation and venous thromboembolism.

name: White mineral oil
description: White mineral oil is a colorless, odorless oil used as a laxative and in various cosmetic and pharmaceutical formulations.

name: Whole Virion Inactivated Corona Virus vaccine
description: Whole Virion Inactivated Corona Virus vaccine is a type of vaccine that uses inactivated virus particles to stimulate an immune response against COVID-19.

name: Xantinol Nicotinate
description: A vasodilator and nootropic agent used to improve blood flow and cognitive function.

name: Xipamide
description: A thiazide-like diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema.

name: Xylitol
description: A sugar alcohol used as a sweetener and dental care agent, known for its cavity-preventing properties.

name: Xylometazoline
description: A topical decongestant used to relieve nasal congestion by constricting blood vessels in the nasal passages.

name: Yellow fever virus
description: An arbovirus transmitted by mosquitoes, causing yellow fever, characterized by fever, chills, loss of appetite, and muscle pain.

name: Zafirlukast
description: Zafirlukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist used in the management of asthma and allergic rhinitis.

name: Zaleplon
description: Zaleplon is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic agent used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.

name: Zaltoprofen
description: Zaltoprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for the treatment of pain and inflammation.

name: Zidovudine
description: Zidovudine is an antiretroviral medication used to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS.

name: Zileuton
description: Zileuton is a leukotriene synthesis inhibitor used for the treatment of asthma.

name: Zinc
description: Zinc is an essential trace element important for various biological functions, including immune response and enzyme activity.

name: Zinc Carnosine
description: Zinc Carnosine is a compound formed from zinc and the peptide carnosine, often used for gastrointestinal health.

name: Zinc Chloride
description: Zinc Chloride is an inorganic compound used in various applications, including as a supplement and in industrial processes.

name: Zinc Gluconate
description: Zinc Gluconate is a zinc salt of gluconic acid, commonly used as a dietary supplement for its zinc content.

name: Zinc Oxide
description: Zinc Oxide is an inorganic compound used in topical ointments, sunscreens, and as a dietary supplement.

name: Zinc Sulfate
description: A zinc salt of sulfuric acid used as a dietary supplement and in the treatment of zinc deficiency.

name: Zinc Sulphate Monohydrate
description: A hydrated form of zinc sulfate commonly used in supplements and as a source of zinc in various applications.

name: Zinc acetate
description: A zinc salt of acetic acid used in dietary supplements and as a treatment for zinc deficiency.

name: Zinc bisglycinate
description: A chelated form of zinc that is bound to glycine, often used for improved absorption in dietary supplements.

name: Zinc pyrithione
description: An organozinc compound used primarily as an antifungal and antibacterial agent in topical formulations.

name: Ziprasidone
description: Ziprasidone is an atypical antipsychotic used primarily to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Zoledronic acid
description: Zoledronic acid is a bisphosphonate used to treat osteoporosis and to prevent skeletal-related events in patients with bone metastases.

name: Zolmitriptan
description: Zolmitriptan is a selective serotonin receptor agonist used for the acute treatment of migraine attacks.

name: Zolpidem
description: Zolpidem is a sedative-hypnotic medication used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.

name: Zonisamide
description: Zonisamide is an anticonvulsant used in the treatment of epilepsy and as an adjunct therapy for partial seizures.

name: Zopiclone
description: Zopiclone is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic agent used for the treatment of insomnia.

name: Zotepine
description: Zotepine is an atypical antipsychotic medication used in the treatment of schizophrenia.

name: Zuclopenthixol
description: Zuclopenthixol is an antipsychotic medication primarily used to treat schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders.

name: charcoal
description: Charcoal is a substance often used in medicine for its adsorbent properties, particularly in cases of poisoning.

name: n Butyl cyanoacrylate
description: n Butyl cyanoacrylate is a fast-acting adhesive commonly used in surgical applications and wound closure.

name: n acetylcarnosine
description: A derivative of carnosine, n-acetylcarnosine is often studied for its potential antioxidant properties and is used in eye drops for cataract treatment.

name: silver nano particles
description: Silver nanoparticles are tiny particles of silver that exhibit antimicrobial properties and are used in various medical and consumer products for their antibacterial effects.

name: sodium perborate monohydrate
description: Sodium perborate monohydrate is a white crystalline compound used primarily as a bleaching agent and in dental applications as a source of hydrogen peroxide.

name: Tazobactam
description: Tazobactam is a beta-lactamase inhibitor that is often combined with other antibiotics to enhance their effectiveness against resistant bacteria.

name: Acetaminophen
description: An analgesic and antipyretic agent, commonly used to relieve pain and reduce fever.

name: Acetate
description: The conjugate base of acetic acid. In pharmaceuticals, it often refers to a salt or ester used as a counterion or in formulations.

name: Acetylcarnosine
description: A dipeptide derivative, a naturally occurring antioxidant and antiglycation agent studied for various potential applications.

name: Acid Phosphate
description: Generally refers to a phosphate salt where not all acidic protons have been replaced, often used as an excipient or buffering agent.

name: Adenosyl Methoinine Disulfate Tosylate
description: A stable salt form of S-Adenosyl-L-methionine (SAMe), a compound involved in several biochemical pathways including transmethylation.

name: Alanyl Glutamine
description: A dipeptide of L-alanine and L-glutamine, used as a nutritional supplement, particularly in parenteral nutrition, to provide a more stable form of glutamine.

name: Ambroxol Hydrochloride
description: A mucolytic agent used to help thin and clear mucus from the respiratory tract by increasing mucociliary clearance.

name: Amikacin Sulfate
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat a wide range of serious bacterial infections, particularly those resistant to other antibiotics.

name: Aminosalicylate
description: A class of anti-inflammatory compounds, typically referring to 5-aminosalicylic acid (mesalazine) and its derivatives, used in conditions like inflammatory bowel disease.

name: Amitriptyline Hydrochloride
description: A tricyclic antidepressant primarily used to treat depression. It is also used for neuropathic pain and migraine prevention.

name: Amoxicillin
description: A penicillin-class beta-lactam antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory tract, ear, nose, throat, skin, and urinary tract.

name: Amphotericin
description: An antifungal medication used for serious systemic fungal infections and leishmaniasis. It works by binding to ergosterol in fungal cell membranes.

name: Anti Rh Immunoglobulin
description: A human immune globulin containing antibodies against the Rh(D) antigen. It is used to prevent Rh sensitization in Rh-negative individuals, particularly during pregnancy or after transfusion.

name: Ascorbate
description: A salt of ascorbic acid, commonly known as Vitamin C. It is an essential nutrient involved in tissue repair, collagen formation, and functions as an antioxidant.

name: Ascorbic Acid
description: A water-soluble vitamin (Vitamin C) essential for various physiological functions, acting as an antioxidant.

name: Bacitracin Zinc
description: An antibiotic, often used topically, that inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.

name: Beclomethasone
description: A synthetic corticosteroid with anti-inflammatory properties, commonly used in inhalers for asthma or nasal sprays for allergic rhinitis.

name: Benzathine Penicillin
description: A long-acting form of penicillin G, a beta-lactam antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.

name: Betahistine Dihydrochloride
description: An anti-vertigo agent thought to improve microcirculation in the inner ear, often used for Meniere's disease.

name: Betahistine Mesylate
description: A histamine analog used to improve symptoms of Meniere's disease, such as vertigo, tinnitus, and hearing loss. It is thought to improve microcirculation in the inner ear.

name: Bicarbonate
description: An anion (HCO3-) vital for maintaining acid-base balance in the body, acting as a primary buffer. It is also a component of many antacids and effervescent formulations.

name: Bisglycinate
description: A chelated form of a mineral (e.g., iron, magnesium) where the mineral is bound to two glycine molecules. This chelation often enhances the bioavailability and absorption of the mineral.

name: Brimonidine Tartrate
description: An alpha-2 adrenergic receptor agonist primarily used in ophthalmic preparations to reduce elevated intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

name: Butyl 2 Cyanoacrylate
description: A medical-grade tissue adhesive or 'super glue' used for wound closure and topical skin approximation. It polymerizes rapidly on contact with moisture, forming a strong bond.

name: Capsaicin
description: A chemical compound found in chili peppers, often used topically as an analgesic to relieve pain.

name: Carbonate
description: A polyatomic anion (CO₃²⁻) and a salt of carbonic acid. It is commonly found in antacids and mineral supplements.

name: Carnitine Tartrate
description: A stable salt form of L-carnitine, an amino acid derivative involved in fatty acid metabolism. It is often used as a dietary supplement.

name: Cephalexin
description: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections.

name: Cetirizine Hydrochloride
description: A second-generation antihistamine that helps relieve symptoms of allergies such as hay fever and hives.

name: Chadox1 Ncov 19 Corona Virus Vaccine
description: A recombinant viral vector vaccine developed for active immunization against SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19).

name: Chiro Inositol
description: D-chiro-inositol, a naturally occurring isomer of inositol that plays a role in cellular signaling pathways.

name: Chloride
description: A major extracellular anion and an essential electrolyte crucial for maintaining fluid balance and electrical neutrality in the body.

name: Chlorpheniramine
description: An antihistamine of the alkylamine class, primarily used to relieve symptoms of allergies.

name: Chymotrypsin
description: A proteolytic enzyme produced in the pancreas that catalyzes the hydrolysis of proteins and polypeptides.

name: Ciprofloxacin Ophthalmic
description: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic formulated for topical administration to the eye. It is used to treat bacterial infections of the eye.

name: Citrate
description: A salt or ester of citric acid. It functions as an anticoagulant, a buffer, or as a chelating agent in various pharmaceutical and medical applications.

name: Citrate Malate
description: A compound that combines citrate and malate. It is often used in dietary supplements, particularly for mineral delivery due to its high bioavailability.

name: Clavulanate
description: A beta-lactamase inhibitor. It is typically combined with beta-lactam antibiotics to protect them from degradation by bacterial beta-lactamase enzymes.

name: Clindamycin Phosphate
description: A water-soluble phosphate ester prodrug of clindamycin, a lincosamide antibiotic. It is rapidly hydrolyzed in vivo to active clindamycin, which inhibits bacterial protein synthesis.

name: Clobetasol Propionate
description: A very potent synthetic corticosteroid used topically to reduce inflammation and itching associated with skin conditions such as psoriasis and eczema.

name: Clostridium Botulinum Type Toxin Haemagglutinin Complex
description: A neurotoxin complex used therapeutically to temporarily paralyze muscles, treating conditions like muscle spasticity, cervical dystonia, and severe primary axillary hyperhidrosis, and for cosmetic reduction of wrinkles.

name: Colistimethate
description: A prodrug of colistin, it is an antibiotic primarily used to treat severe infections caused by multi-drug resistant Gram-negative bacteria, particularly in hospitalized patients.

name: Coral
description: Refers to calcified marine invertebrates, often used as a natural source of calcium supplementation or as a biocompatible material in bone graft substitutes.

name: Cromoglycate
description: A mast cell stabilizer that prevents the release of inflammatory mediators like histamine, primarily used to prevent allergic reactions such as asthma, allergic rhinitis, and allergic conjunctivitis.

name: Cyproheptadine Hcl
description: An antihistamine with antiserotonergic properties, used to relieve allergy symptoms and as an appetite stimulant.

name: Cyproheptadine Hydrochloride
description: An antihistamine with antiserotonergic properties, used to relieve allergy symptoms and as an appetite stimulant.

name: Dextromethorphan
description: A cough suppressant (antitussive) that acts on the cough center in the brain.

name: Dextromethorphan Hbr
description: The hydrobromide salt of dextromethorphan, a cough suppressant (antitussive) that acts on the cough center in the brain.

name: Di Edetate
description: A chelating agent commonly used in pharmaceuticals and cosmetics to bind metal ions, improving stability.

name: Di Hydrogen Citrate
description: A salt or ester of citric acid, often used as an acidulant, buffering agent, or for its anticoagulant properties.

name: Diatrizoate
description: An iodinated radiographic contrast medium used for X-ray imaging of various body parts.

name: Dibasic Phosphate
description: A phosphate salt (e.g., disodium phosphate) commonly used as a buffering agent, electrolyte replenisher, or laxative.

name: Dicyclomine Hydrochloride
description: An anticholinergic and antispasmodic medication used to treat symptoms associated with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

name: Dioctyl Sulfosuccinate
description: A surfactant-type laxative, also known as docusate, used as a stool softener to prevent and treat constipation.

name: Diphenhydramine Hydrochloride
description: An antihistamine with anticholinergic and sedative properties, commonly used to relieve symptoms of allergies and as a sleep aid.

name: Dobesilate
description: A synthetic angioprotective agent used to improve capillary resistance and reduce permeability, primarily in conditions like diabetic retinopathy and chronic venous insufficiency.

name: Domperidone Maleate
description: A dopamine antagonist with antiemetic and prokinetic properties, used to relieve nausea, vomiting, and gastric motility disorders.

name: Doxorubicin Hydrochloride
description: An anthracycline topoisomerase inhibitor chemotherapy agent, widely used in the treatment of various cancers including breast cancer, lymphomas, and leukemias.

name: Doxylamine Succinate
description: An antihistamine with prominent sedative effects, often used as a short-term treatment for insomnia and as an ingredient in combination cold and allergy medications.

name: Escitalopram
description: A selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant, primarily used to treat major depressive disorder and generalized anxiety disorder.

name: Feredetate
description: An iron chelate complex, typically used as an iron supplement to treat or prevent iron deficiency anemia.

name: Fexofenadine Hydrochloride
description: A second-generation antihistamine that helps relieve symptoms of seasonal allergic rhinitis and chronic idiopathic urticaria.

name: Flavoured Mentholated Base
description: A pharmaceutical base incorporating flavoring agents and menthol, often used in lozenges or topical preparations to provide a cooling sensation.

name: Flucloxacillin
description: A narrow-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic of the penicillin class, effective against susceptible Gram-positive bacteria, particularly Staphylococcus species.

name: Fluoride
description: An inorganic anion of fluorine, widely used in various forms for the prevention of dental caries and sometimes for water fluoridation.

name: Flupentixol
description: A typical antipsychotic medication of the thioxanthene class, used in the treatment of psychotic disorders like schizophrenia.

name: Freeze Dried Live Attenuated Hepatitis Vaccine
description: A vaccine formulation containing a weakened, live form of the hepatitis virus, which has been freeze-dried for stability and reconstitution before administration to prevent hepatitis.

name: Fusidate
description: An antibacterial agent, commonly as fusidic acid or its sodium salt, primarily effective against Gram-positive bacteria, particularly Staphylococcus species.

name: Gentamicin Sulfate
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, particularly those caused by Gram-negative bacteria.

name: Gluconate
description: An anion or salt of gluconic acid, often used to deliver minerals (e.g., calcium, iron, zinc) in supplements due to its good bioavailability.

name: Glucosamine Sulfate
description: An amino sugar naturally found in cartilage and often used in dietary supplements for joint health.

name: Glucosamine Sulfate Chloride
description: A specific salt form of glucosamine, often combined with potassium chloride, used in supplements primarily for joint support.

name: Glutamate
description: The anion of glutamic acid, an amino acid that functions as an excitatory neurotransmitter and a common food additive for flavor enhancement.

name: Glutamine
description: A conditionally essential amino acid, vital for immune cell function, gut health, and protein synthesis within the body.

name: Glutathione Reduced
description: A tripeptide (cysteine, glycine, and glutamic acid) found in living cells, crucial for antioxidant defense and various metabolic processes.

name: Glycerophosphate
description: An organic phosphate ester of glycerol, serving as a source of phosphate and glycerol for metabolic processes and phospholipid synthesis.

name: Glyceryl Trinitrate
description: An organic nitrate prodrug for nitric oxide, primarily used as a vasodilator.

name: Glyceryl Trinitrate Per
description: An organic nitrate prodrug for nitric oxide, primarily used as a vasodilator.

name: Haemophilus Influenzae Type Capsular Polysaccharide
description: A specific carbohydrate antigen from the capsule of *Haemophilus influenzae* type b bacteria, used in vaccines to induce an immune response.

name: Haemophilus Type Conjugate Vaccine
description: A vaccine containing purified capsular polysaccharide from Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib), chemically linked to a protein carrier. It is used for active immunization against invasive Hib disease.

name: Hepatitis Vaccine
description: A vaccine that stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies against hepatitis viruses, most commonly Hepatitis B virus. It is used for active immunization to prevent hepatitis infection.

name: Human Hepatitis Immunoglobulin
description: A sterile solution of antibodies (immunoglobulins), primarily IgG, derived from human plasma with high titers of anti-HBs. It provides passive immunization against Hepatitis B virus.

name: Hyaluronate
description: The salt form of hyaluronic acid, a naturally occurring glycosaminoglycan found in connective tissues. It functions as a lubricant and shock absorber, and is used in various medical and cosmetic applications.

name: Hydrogen Carbonate
description: Also known as bicarbonate (HCO₃⁻), an anion that plays a vital role in the body's acid-base buffering system. It is often administered as sodium bicarbonate for correction of metabolic acidosis.

name: Hydroxide
description: A chemical anion (OH-) often found in bases or alkalis. In pharmacy, frequently used in compounds like antacids or as a pH modifier.

name: Hydroxyzine Hydrochloride
description: An antihistamine with sedative and anxiolytic properties, used to treat itching caused by allergies and as a short-term treatment for anxiety.

name: Hypromellose
description: A semi-synthetic, inert, viscoelastic polymer used as an excipient in various pharmaceutical formulations, including oral and ophthalmic preparations, often for thickening or lubrication.

name: Inactivated Hepatitis Vaccine
description: A type of vaccine containing inactivated (killed) hepatitis virus, administered to stimulate an immune response and provide protection against hepatitis infection.

name: Interferon Alpha
description: A type of interferon, a naturally occurring cytokine that plays a role in the immune system. It is used as a biopharmaceutical to treat certain viral infections and cancers due to its antiviral and immunomodulatory effects.

name: Iodide
description: The ionic form of iodine, an essential trace element. It is crucial for the synthesis of thyroid hormones and proper thyroid function.

name: Isoleucine
description: An essential branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) that the body cannot synthesize. It is involved in protein synthesis, energy metabolism, and muscle tissue repair.

name: Lactate
description: An anion and a byproduct of anaerobic glycolysis, particularly during intense physical activity. It also plays a role in energy production and electrolyte balance.

name: Lactic Acid Bacillus Spores
description: Spore-forming bacteria, typically from the Bacillus genus, known for producing lactic acid. They are often used as probiotics to support digestive health and microbial balance.

name: Lactobacillus Spores
description: Probiotic bacteria belonging to the Lactobacillus genus, commonly utilized to support a healthy gut microbiome and digestive function.

name: Lactobionate
description: A salt of lactobionic acid, often used as a counterion in pharmaceutical formulations to enhance drug solubility or stability.

name: Leucine
description: An essential branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) involved in protein synthesis, muscle repair, and metabolism.

name: Leucovorin
description: A formyl derivative of tetrahydrofolic acid, used to reduce the toxicity of certain chemotherapy agents and to treat megaloblastic anemia due to folate deficiency.

name: Levocetirizine Dihydrochloride
description: The active levorotatory enantiomer of cetirizine, functioning as a selective H1-receptor antagonist primarily used for allergic conditions.

name: Levothyroxine
description: A synthetic form of the thyroid hormone thyroxine (T4), used as a hormone replacement therapy for hypothyroidism.

name: Liposomal Amphotericin
description: An antifungal agent formulated as a liposomal preparation of amphotericin B. This formulation is designed to reduce toxicity compared to conventional amphotericin B.

name: Mecobalamin
description: An active coenzyme form of Vitamin B12 (cobalamin), also known as methylcobalamin. It is essential for nerve tissue health and red blood cell formation.

name: Mefenamic Acid Dicyclomine
description: A combination medication containing mefenamic acid, a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), and dicyclomine, an anticholinergic antispasmodic agent.

name: Menadione Bisulfite
description: A synthetic, water-soluble form of Vitamin K3. It acts as a precursor for other forms of Vitamin K, which are crucial for blood coagulation.

name: Metabisulphite
description: A chemical compound (commonly sodium or potassium metabisulphite) used as an antioxidant, preservative, and disinfectant in various pharmaceutical and industrial applications.

name: Metformin Hcl
description: An oral biguanide antidiabetic medication used to lower blood glucose levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, primarily by reducing hepatic glucose production.

name: Metformin Hydrochloride
description: An oral biguanide medication prescribed to manage high blood sugar levels in individuals with type 2 diabetes mellitus, often as an adjunct to diet and exercise.

name: Methyl Folate
description: An active form of folate, used to manage folate deficiency, particularly in individuals with impaired conversion of dietary folic acid, supporting neurological function and red blood cell formation.

name: Methylcobalamin Per
description: An active coenzyme form of Vitamin B12, essential for treating vitamin B12 deficiency, supporting neurological health, and promoting healthy red blood cell formation.

name: Methylfolate
description: Active form of folate used to treat folate deficiency, especially in individuals with impaired folate metabolism, and to manage symptoms like depression or neuropathy associated with low folate levels.

name: Methylsulfonylmethane
description: An organic sulfur compound commonly used as a dietary supplement to reduce joint pain, inflammation, and stiffness, particularly in conditions like osteoarthritis.

name: Metoprolol
description: A beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, angina, heart failure, and to prevent migraine headaches by reducing heart rate and blood pressure.

name: Miconazole Nitrate
description: An antifungal agent used topically or vaginally to treat various fungal skin infections, such as athlete's foot and ringworm, and candidiasis (yeast infections).

name: Micronized Progesterone
description: A form of progesterone used in hormone replacement therapy, to treat secondary amenorrhea, and for luteal phase support in assisted reproductive technologies.

name: Milk Magnesia
description: Used as an antacid to relieve indigestion and heartburn, and as a laxative to treat occasional constipation.

name: Mometasone Furoate
description: A potent corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation and treat conditions like asthma, allergic rhinitis, and certain skin conditions.

name: Monobasic Phosphate
description: Used as an electrolyte replacement for hypophosphatemia and as a laxative for constipation or bowel preparation before medical procedures.

name: Monofluorophosphate
description: A fluoride compound primarily used in toothpaste and other dental products to help prevent tooth decay (dental caries).

name: Montelukast Cetirizine
description: A combination medication containing a leukotriene receptor antagonist and an antihistamine, used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis and prevent asthma attacks.

name: Moxifloxacin Hydrochloride
description: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, including acute bacterial sinusitis, acute exacerbations of chronic bronchitis, and community-acquired pneumonia.

name: Multimineral Salts
description: A dietary supplement providing a combination of essential minerals, often used to prevent or treat mineral deficiencies and support various physiological functions.

name: Multivitamin Complex
description: A dietary supplement comprising several essential vitamins, formulated to prevent or treat vitamin deficiencies and support general health and well-being.

name: Multivitamins
description: A nutritional supplement containing various vitamins, commonly used to prevent or treat vitamin deficiencies and maintain overall health.

name: Mycophenolate
description: An immunosuppressant medication used to prevent organ rejection in transplant patients and in the treatment of certain autoimmune diseases.

name: Naloxone Hydrochloride
description: A mu-opioid receptor antagonist used to reverse the effects of opioid overdose, including respiratory depression.

name: Naphazoline Hydrochloride
description: An alpha-adrenergic agonist used topically as a vasoconstrictor to relieve nasal congestion or ocular redness.

name: Nebivolol Hydrochloride
description: A beta-1 selective adrenergic receptor blocker with vasodilating properties, used in the treatment of hypertension and heart failure.

name: Nefedipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used to treat hypertension and chronic stable angina pectoris.

name: Nefopam Hydrochloride
description: A non-opioid, non-NSAID analgesic used for the relief of moderate to severe acute and chronic pain.

name: Neisseria Meningitidis Group
description: A bacterium that causes meningococcal disease, including meningitis and bloodstream infections; vaccines are available to prevent infections caused by specific serogroups.

name: Nemesis
description: Not a recognized pharmaceutical composition or active ingredient.

name: Neomycin Sulfate
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used topically to treat bacterial skin infections and orally to suppress intestinal bacteria before surgery or in hepatic encephalopathy.

name: Neomycin Sulphate
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used topically to treat bacterial skin infections and orally to suppress intestinal bacteria before surgery or in hepatic encephalopathy.

name: Netilmicin Sulfate
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic administered intravenously or intramuscularly to treat serious bacterial infections, particularly those caused by gram-negative bacteria resistant to other aminoglycosides.

name: Niflumic Acid
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain and inflammation, particularly in rheumatological conditions and acute traumatic injuries.

name: Nifuroxazide
description: An intestinal antiseptic primarily used to treat acute bacterial diarrhea by acting locally within the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Nimapimod
description: An investigational p38 alpha mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) inhibitor being studied for its potential to reduce neuroinflammation in neurological disorders like Alzheimer's disease.

name: Nimesulide Paracetamol
description: A combination medication containing an NSAID (nimesulide) and an analgesic/antipyretic (paracetamol) used for the relief of pain, fever, and inflammation.

name: Nimustine
description: An alkylating antineoplastic agent used in chemotherapy for the treatment of various cancers, including malignant brain tumors and gastric carcinoma.

name: Nitrate
description: Used as vasodilators to relieve angina pectoris by reducing myocardial oxygen demand and increasing coronary blood flow.

name: Norethisterone Acetate
description: A synthetic progestogen used in hormonal contraception, hormone replacement therapy, and to treat endometriosis and dysfunctional uterine bleeding.

name: Nortriptyline Hydrochloride
description: A tricyclic antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder and chronic neuropathic pain.

name: Noxistine
description: Primarily used as an antihistamine to treat or prevent nausea, vomiting, and dizziness associated with motion sickness.

name: Numicoxib
description: A selective cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) inhibitor used for its anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antipyretic properties, particularly in treating osteoarthritis.

name: Omega 3 Fatty Acid
description: Used to reduce elevated triglyceride levels and may provide cardiovascular benefits. It is also important for brain development and function.

name: Ondansetron Hcl Di
description: An antiemetic used to prevent nausea and vomiting induced by chemotherapy, radiotherapy, or surgery.

name: Ondansetron Hydrochloride
description: A serotonin 5-HT3 receptor antagonist used to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with cancer chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and surgery.

name: Ondansetron Hydrochloride Di
description: An antiemetic agent used for the prevention and treatment of nausea and vomiting, particularly those induced by chemotherapy or surgery.

name: Ornidazole Ciprofloxacin
description: A combination antibiotic used to treat mixed infections caused by susceptible aerobic and anaerobic bacteria, as well as certain protozoal organisms.

name: Ornithine Aspartate
description: Used in the treatment of hyperammonemia, particularly in patients with liver cirrhosis, by supporting ammonia detoxification.

name: Oxide
description: Often refers to metal oxides like Zinc Oxide, used topically as a skin protectant, astringent, and mild antiseptic.

name: Oxymetazoline Hydrochloride
description: An alpha-adrenergic agonist used as a topical nasal decongestant to relieve nasal stuffiness and sinus pressure.

name: Oxytocics And Prostaglandin E1 E2 And Products Cervical Dilatation
description: This category includes agents that stimulate uterine contractions (oxytocics) and prostaglandins (E1, E2) used for cervical ripening, labor induction, and management of postpartum hemorrhage.

name: Panthenol
description: A derivative of pantothenic acid (vitamin B5), used topically to moisturize, soothe, and promote healing of the skin.

name: Pantothenate
description: A vitamin B5 derivative, used as a nutritional supplement to support metabolic processes and cellular function.

name: Pegylated Interferon Alpha
description: A modified form of interferon alpha, used in the treatment of chronic hepatitis B and C virus infections and certain types of cancer.

name: Pentosan Polysulfate
description: An oral anticoagulant and anti-inflammatory agent used to relieve bladder pain and discomfort associated with interstitial cystitis.

name: Perborate
description: A compound often used as an antiseptic or bleaching agent, particularly in dental applications like endodontic tooth bleaching.

name: Pheniramine Maleate
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic reactions such as sneezing, runny nose, watery eyes, and itching.

name: Phenylephrine Hcl
description: An alpha-1 adrenergic agonist used as a nasal decongestant to relieve stuffiness and as a vasopressor to increase blood pressure.

name: Phenylephrine Hydrochloride
description: An alpha-1 adrenergic agonist used as a nasal decongestant to relieve stuffiness and as a vasopressor to increase blood pressure.

name: Phosphate
description: An essential electrolyte involved in bone health and metabolic processes. It is used in some formulations as a laxative or for electrolyte replacement.

name: Picosulfate
description: A stimulant laxative used for the short-term relief of constipation or for bowel preparation before medical procedures.

name: Polymyxin
description: An antibiotic primarily used to treat infections caused by Gram-negative bacteria, often administered topically for skin or eye infections.

name: Polymyxin Sulfate
description: An antibiotic primarily used topically to treat infections caused by susceptible Gram-negative bacteria, particularly in skin, eye, and ear infections.

name: Polystyrene Sulphonate
description: An ion-exchange resin used to treat hyperkalemia by binding potassium ions in the gastrointestinal tract, facilitating their excretion.

name: Pralidoxime Chloride
description: An oxime compound used as an antidote to reverse poisoning by organophosphate acetylcholinesterase inhibitors by reactivating the enzyme.

name: Pregabalin Nortriptyline
description: A combination medication used to treat neuropathic pain; pregabalin reduces nerve hyperexcitability, and nortriptyline provides antidepressant and analgesic effects.

name: Procaine Penicillin
description: A long-acting form of penicillin G, an antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections susceptible to penicillin, typically administered via intramuscular injection.

name: Promethazine Hydrochloride
description: An antihistamine with sedative properties, primarily used to treat allergic reactions, motion sickness, nausea, vomiting, and for short-term sedation.

name: Pseudoephedrine Hydrochloride
description: A sympathomimetic decongestant used to relieve nasal and sinus congestion caused by colds, allergies, and hay fever.

name: Pseudoephedrine Sulphate
description: A sympathomimetic decongestant used to relieve nasal and sinus congestion associated with the common cold, allergies, and hay fever.

name: Purified Water
description: A high-purity water used as a solvent, diluent, or vehicle for preparing pharmaceutical products, solutions, and for cleaning medical equipment.

name: Pyridoxal 5 Phosphate
description: The biologically active form of vitamin B6, essential for numerous metabolic processes and often used as a dietary supplement or to treat vitamin B6 deficiencies.

name: Pyridoxine
description: Pyridoxine is Vitamin B6, essential for various metabolic processes including amino acid and neurotransmitter synthesis. It is used to treat or prevent vitamin B6 deficiency and certain metabolic disorders.

name: Pyridoxine Hcl
description: Pyridoxine Hydrochloride is the salt form of Vitamin B6, commonly used to treat or prevent vitamin B6 deficiency. It is also used in the management of isoniazid-induced peripheral neuropathy.

name: Pyridoxine Hydrochloride
description: Pyridoxine Hydrochloride is the salt form of Vitamin B6, essential for metabolic processes. It is used to treat or prevent vitamin B6 deficiency and to manage isoniazid-induced peripheral neuropathy.

name: Riboflavin
description: Riboflavin is Vitamin B2, a coenzyme vital for cellular growth, energy production, and metabolism. It is used to treat or prevent riboflavin deficiency (ariboflavinosis) and for migraine prophylaxis.

name: Ringers Lactate
description: Ringer's lactate solution is an intravenous fluid used for fluid and electrolyte replenishment in cases of hypovolemia, dehydration, or metabolic acidosis. It contains sodium, chloride, potassium, calcium, and lactate.

name: Ritodrine Hydrochloride
description: A beta-2 adrenergic agonist used as a tocolytic agent to inhibit uterine contractions in cases of preterm labor.

name: Sevelamer Carbonate
description: A non-absorbable phosphate binder used to control serum phosphorus levels in patients with chronic kidney disease who are on dialysis.

name: Stibogluconate
description: An antimony-containing antiprotozoal agent primarily used in the treatment of various forms of leishmaniasis.

name: Sulphate
description: An inorganic salt, commonly magnesium sulphate, used as an electrolyte replacement, anticonvulsant for eclampsia, and an osmotic laxative.

name: Tauroglycocholate
description: A conjugated bile salt that aids in the digestion and absorption of dietary fats and fat-soluble vitamins in the small intestine.

name: Terbinafine Hydrochloride
description: An allylamine antifungal agent used to treat dermatophyte infections of the skin and nails by inhibiting ergosterol synthesis.

name: Terbutaline Sulfate
description: A selective beta-2 adrenergic agonist used as a bronchodilator to relieve bronchospasm in conditions like asthma and COPD.

name: Terpin
description: An expectorant historically used to help clear mucus from the airways and relieve cough in respiratory conditions.

name: Thiopental
description: An ultrashort-acting barbiturate used intravenously for the induction of general anesthesia and for short surgical procedures.

name: Thymidine
description: A nucleoside that is a component of DNA, often used in research as a marker for DNA synthesis or as a precursor in biochemical studies.

name: Timolol Maleate
description: A non-selective beta-blocker primarily used as an ophthalmic solution to reduce elevated intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

name: Tobramycin Sulphate
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, particularly those affecting the eyes (e.g., conjunctivitis) or lungs (e.g., in cystic fibrosis).

name: Torsemide
description: A loop diuretic used to treat edema associated with congestive heart failure, renal disease, or hepatic cirrhosis, and for the management of hypertension.

name: Tramadol Hydrochloride
description: An opioid analgesic used for the management of moderate to moderately severe pain in adults.

name: Tribasic Phosphate
description: Often used as a dietary supplement to provide calcium and phosphate, and can also be found in antacid formulations to neutralize stomach acid.

name: Trisilicate
description: Magnesium trisilicate is an antacid that neutralizes stomach acid to relieve symptoms of indigestion, heartburn, and acid reflux.

name: Unknown Component
description: A placeholder for an undefined substance, its clinical or medicinal properties cannot be described.

name: Valproate
description: Valproate is an anticonvulsant and mood stabilizer used to treat epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and for migraine prophylaxis.

name: Vancomycin Hydrochloride
description: Vancomycin is an antibiotic primarily used to treat serious Gram-positive bacterial infections, including MRSA and Clostridioides difficile-associated disease.

name: Vi Capsular Polysaccharide Salmonella Typhi
description: This polysaccharide is an antigen used in vaccines to provide active immunization against typhoid fever caused by Salmonella Typhi.

name: Vitamin
description: Essential organic compounds required in small quantities for normal metabolic function, growth, and overall health. They are used to treat or prevent specific deficiency diseases.

name: Water
description: The primary component of body fluids, essential for hydration and numerous physiological processes. Used clinically as a solvent for medications or for rehydration in various forms.

name: Xylometazoline Hydrochloride
description: An alpha-adrenergic agonist used as a topical nasal decongestant to relieve symptoms of nasal congestion due to colds, allergies, and sinusitis.

name: Zinc Sulphate
description: A zinc salt used as a dietary supplement to treat or prevent zinc deficiency. It also has astringent properties and is used topically in some dermatological preparations.

name: B complex Vitamins
description: A combination of essential water-soluble vitamins (e.g., B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B7, B9, B12) crucial for cellular metabolism and energy production. They are used to treat or prevent deficiencies, particularly in conditions like malnutrition or malabsorption.Abiraterone

name: Acebutolol
description: A beta-adrenergic blocker used in the management of hypertension, angina pectoris, and cardiac arrhythmias.

name: Acemetacin
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for the symptomatic relief of pain and inflammation in musculoskeletal and joint disorders.

name: Acepromazine
description: A phenothiazine derivative primarily used as a tranquilizer and sedative in veterinary medicine for its calming and antiemetic effects.

name: Aceprometazine
description: A veterinary sedative and tranquilizer, combining acepromazine for tranquilization with promethazine for antihistaminic and additional sedative effects.

name: Acetohydroxamic Acid
description: A urease inhibitor used to prevent stone formation and reduce ammonia levels in the urine in patients with chronic urea-splitting urinary tract infections.

name: Acetophenazine
description: An antipsychotic medication of the phenothiazine class used to manage symptoms of psychotic disorders, such as schizophrenia.

name: Acetylcholine
description: A neurotransmitter that, when administered topically in ophthalmic surgery, rapidly induces miosis (pupil constriction).

name: Acetyldigitoxin
description: A cardiac glycoside used to increase the force of myocardial contraction in congestive heart failure and to control ventricular rate in atrial fibrillation.

name: Acetylsalicylic Acid
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used as an analgesic for pain, an antipyretic for fever, and an antiplatelet agent to prevent cardiovascular events.

name: Acipimox
description: A nicotinic acid derivative used as a lipid-lowering agent to reduce elevated plasma triglyceride and cholesterol levels in dyslipidemia.

name: Aclidinium
description: An inhaled long-acting muscarinic antagonist (LAMA) used for the maintenance treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) to improve lung function.

name: Activated Charcoal
description: An adsorbent used in acute oral poisonings and drug overdoses to prevent gastrointestinal absorption of toxins.

name: Adefovir Dipivoxil
description: An oral nucleotide analogue reverse transcriptase inhibitor used for the treatment of chronic hepatitis B virus infection in adults with active viral replication.

name: Adinazolam
description: A triazolobenzodiazepine, historically investigated as an anxiolytic agent for the treatment of anxiety disorders.

name: Afatinib
description: An epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) tyrosine kinase inhibitor used for the treatment of specific types of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with EGFR mutations.

name: Ajmaline
description: An antiarrhythmic agent used to treat various cardiac arrhythmias, primarily re-entrant tachycardias.

name: Alclofenac
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for its analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects in conditions like rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.

name: Alclometasone
description: A topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation and itching associated with various dermatoses, including eczema and psoriasis.

name: Alectinib
description: A kinase inhibitor used in the treatment of ALK-positive metastatic non-small cell lung cancer.

name: Alfentanil
description: A rapid-acting opioid analgesic used for short-duration pain management, often as an adjunct to general anesthesia.

name: Alimemazine
description: An antihistamine primarily used for its sedative and anxiolytic effects in the short-term treatment of insomnia and anxiety.

name: Alitretinoin
description: A retinoid used topically to treat severe chronic hand eczema unresponsive to potent topical corticosteroids.

name: Almasilate
description: An antacid containing aluminum and magnesium, used to neutralize stomach acid and relieve symptoms of heartburn and indigestion.

name: Alosetron
description: A selective 5-HT3 receptor antagonist indicated for the treatment of severe diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome (IBS-D) in women.

name: Alprenolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenergic blocker used to treat hypertension, angina pectoris, and certain cardiac arrhythmias.

name: Alum
description: Functions as an astringent and antiseptic, often used topically to constrict tissues, stop minor bleeding, or reduce sweating.

name: Aluminium
description: As a metal, its various salts and compounds are widely used in medicine for their astringent, antacid, or phosphate-binding properties.

name: Aluminum Hydroxide
description: Acts as an antacid to relieve heartburn and indigestion, and as a phosphate binder to reduce high phosphate levels in kidney disease.

name: Aluminum Oxide
description: Used as an abrasive in dental and dermatological preparations for polishing and exfoliation, and as a component in some sunscreens for UV protection.

name: Aluminum Sulfate
description: Utilized as an astringent and styptic in topical preparations to contract tissues, reduce secretions, and control minor bleeding.

name: Alvimopan
description: A peripherally acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist used to accelerate gastrointestinal recovery following partial large or small bowel resection with primary anastomosis.

name: Ambenonium
description: A cholinesterase inhibitor used in the symptomatic treatment of myasthenia gravis to improve muscle strength.

name: Amcinonide
description: A topical corticosteroid used for the relief of inflammatory and pruritic manifestations of corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses.

name: Aminocaproic Acid
description: An antifibrinolytic agent used to prevent or reduce hemorrhage by inhibiting fibrinolysis in various conditions, such as during surgery or in certain bleeding disorders.

name: Aminoglutethimide
description: An aromatase inhibitor and adrenal steroidogenesis inhibitor used in the treatment of metastatic breast cancer in postmenopausal women and Cushing's syndrome.

name: Aminohippuric Acid
description: Used to measure effective renal plasma flow and assess renal tubular function, aiding in the diagnosis of kidney disorders.

name: Aminolevulinic Acid
description: A photosensitizer used in photodynamic therapy for the treatment of actinic keratosis and superficial basal cell carcinoma, and as a diagnostic aid in certain cancers.

name: Aminophenazone
description: Historically used as an analgesic and antipyretic for pain and fever relief. Its use is now restricted due to safety concerns.

name: Aminosalicylic Acid
description: An antibiotic used as a second-line agent in combination therapy for the treatment of multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

name: Amobarbital
description: A barbiturate with sedative-hypnotic properties, used for short-term treatment of insomnia, relief of anxiety, and as a pre-anesthetic sedative.

name: Amphetamine
description: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.

name: Amprenavir
description: An antiretroviral protease inhibitor used in combination with other drugs for the treatment of HIV infection.

name: Amrubicin
description: An anthracycline topoisomerase II inhibitor used as a chemotherapy agent for the treatment of certain cancers, particularly non-small cell lung cancer.

name: Amsacrine
description: A DNA intercalating topoisomerase II inhibitor used as a chemotherapy agent in the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia (AML).

name: Amyl Nitrite
description: A rapid-acting vasodilator primarily used for the acute relief of angina pectoris and as an antidote for cyanide poisoning.

name: Anagrelide
description: Anagrelide is an oral antiplatelet agent used to reduce elevated platelet counts in patients with essential thrombocythemia. It functions by inhibiting megakaryocyte maturation.

name: Anisotropine Methylbromide
description: Anisotropine methylbromide is an anticholinergic antispasmodic agent used to relieve smooth muscle spasms in the gastrointestinal tract. It helps manage symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome.

name: Antazoline
description: Antazoline is an H1-receptor antagonist used topically, often in combination with a decongestant, to relieve ocular itching and redness associated with allergic conjunctivitis.

name: Antipyrine
description: Antipyrine is an analgesic and antipyretic agent, primarily used in combination with benzocaine in otic solutions. It helps relieve pain and inflammation associated with acute otitis media.

name: Aprindine
description: Aprindine is a Class IC antiarrhythmic agent that blocks fast sodium channels, used to treat various ventricular and supraventricular tachyarrhythmias. Its use is limited due to potential toxicity.

name: Arbekacin
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic primarily used for treating serious bacterial infections, including those caused by multidrug-resistant strains like MRSA.

name: Arbutamine
description: A beta-1 adrenergic agonist used as a pharmacologic stress agent in cardiac imaging to simulate exercise and evaluate myocardial ischemia.

name: Argatroban
description: A direct thrombin inhibitor used as an anticoagulant for the prophylaxis or treatment of thrombosis in patients with heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT).

name: Arotinolol
description: A beta-blocker with additional alpha-1 blocking properties, used for managing essential hypertension, angina pectoris, and certain arrhythmias.

name: Articaine
description: An amide-type local anesthetic with a rapid onset and intermediate duration of action, commonly used for local or regional anesthesia in dental procedures.

name: Asunaprevir
description: An antiviral medication classified as an NS3/4A protease inhibitor. It is used in combination with other antivirals to treat chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, specifically genotypes 1b and 4.

name: Atovaquone
description: An antiprotozoal agent used to treat and prevent *Pneumocystis jirovecii* pneumonia (PCP). It is also used in combination with proguanil for the prophylaxis and treatment of malaria.

name: Atracurium Besylate
description: A nondepolarizing neuromuscular blocker used as an adjunct to general anesthesia. It facilitates tracheal intubation and provides skeletal muscle relaxation during surgery or mechanical ventilation.

name: Aurothiomalate
description: A gold salt used as a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD). It is indicated for the treatment of active rheumatoid arthritis, particularly in patients who have not responded to other therapies.

name: Azatadine
description: A first-generation H1-antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of seasonal and perennial allergic rhinitis, such as sneezing, rhinorrhea, and pruritus. It also treats chronic idiopathic urticaria.

name: Azidocillin
description: A penicillin antibiotic used for treating bacterial infections, particularly those caused by susceptible Gram-positive organisms like streptococci and staphylococci.

name: Azlocillin
description: An extended-spectrum penicillin antibiotic effective against a broad range of Gram-negative bacteria, including Pseudomonas aeruginosa, in treating severe infections.

name: Barnidipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used for the treatment of essential hypertension by causing vasodilation and reducing peripheral resistance.

name: Bazedoxifene
description: A selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) used for the treatment and prevention of postmenopausal osteoporosis.

name: Beclomethasone Dipropionate
description: A potent corticosteroid with anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive properties, primarily used in inhaled formulations for asthma and rhinitis, or topically for skin conditions.

name: Bedaquiline
description: An antimicrobial used to treat adults with pulmonary multidrug-resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB) as part of a combination regimen.

name: Belinostat
description: A histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor used to treat relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL).

name: Bendroflumethiazide
description: A thiazide diuretic used to manage edema associated with congestive heart failure and to treat hypertension.

name: Benzatropine
description: An anticholinergic agent used to treat parkinsonism and to control drug-induced extrapyramidal disorders.

name: Benznidazole
description: An antiparasitic medication primarily used for the treatment of Chagas disease (American trypanosomiasis).

name: Benzoctamine
description: A tranquilizer used for the short-term treatment of anxiety states and tension.

name: Benzophenone
description: Primarily used as a UV filter in sunscreens and other topical preparations to protect against ultraviolet radiation.

name: Benzphetamine
description: A sympathomimetic amine used as an appetite suppressant for the short-term management of exogenous obesity.

name: Benzylpenicillin
description: A beta-lactam antibiotic (Penicillin G) effective against a wide range of gram-positive bacteria, used to treat various bacterial infections including syphilis and serious streptococcal infections.

name: Bepridil
description: A calcium channel blocker used to treat chronic stable angina pectoris, particularly when other antianginal agents are ineffective or not tolerated.

name: Bethanidine
description: An adrenergic neuron blocking agent previously used to treat moderate to severe hypertension, primarily when other antihypertensives were ineffective.

name: Betrixaban
description: A direct factor Xa inhibitor anticoagulant used for the prophylaxis of venous thromboembolism (VTE) in adult patients hospitalized for an acute medical illness.

name: Bevantolol
description: A beta-adrenergic receptor blocking agent that was investigated for its use in treating hypertension and angina pectoris.

name: Bexarotene
description: A retinoid used for the treatment of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL) in patients who are refractory to at least one prior systemic therapy.

name: Biperiden
description: An anticholinergic agent primarily used to treat all forms of Parkinson's disease, particularly drug-induced parkinsonism and extrapyramidal symptoms.

name: Bismuth Subcitrate
description: Used as an anti-ulcer agent and in combination therapies to eradicate Helicobacter pylori infections by inhibiting bacterial growth and protecting the gastric mucosa.

name: Bismuth Subsalicylate
description: An antidiarrheal and antacid agent used to treat temporary discomforts of the stomach and gastrointestinal tract, such as nausea, indigestion, and diarrhea.

name: Boceprevir
description: An antiviral drug, specifically a protease inhibitor, used in combination with peginterferon alfa and ribavirin for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C genotype 1 infection.

name: Bopindolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenoceptor antagonist used primarily in the management of hypertension and angina pectoris.

name: Bretylium
description: An antiarrhythmic agent primarily used for the treatment of life-threatening ventricular fibrillation and refractory ventricular tachycardia.

name: Brexpiprazole
description: An atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and as an adjunctive treatment for major depressive disorder.

name: Brigatinib
description: A kinase inhibitor used to treat anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)-positive metastatic non-small cell lung cancer.

name: Bromazepam
description: A benzodiazepine anxiolytic used for the short-term symptomatic treatment of anxiety and panic disorders.

name: Bromopride
description: A prokinetic and antiemetic agent used to treat nausea, vomiting, and symptoms of gastroesophageal reflux disease.

name: Brompheniramine
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergies, such as sneezing, runny nose, and watery eyes.

name: Brotizolam
description: A thienotriazolodiazepine used as a short-acting hypnotic for the short-term treatment of insomnia due to its sedative and anxiolytic properties.

name: Bumetanide
description: A loop diuretic used to treat edema associated with congestive heart failure, hepatic cirrhosis, and renal disease, by promoting increased excretion of water and electrolytes.

name: Bupranolol
description: A non-selective beta-blocker used in the treatment of hypertension, angina pectoris, and for reducing intraocular pressure in glaucoma.

name: Butabarbital
description: A barbiturate used for its sedative and hypnotic effects, primarily for short-term treatment of insomnia or as a pre-operative sedative.

name: Butalbital
description: A barbiturate commonly used in combination with other analgesics (e.g., acetaminophen, aspirin, caffeine) for the symptomatic relief of tension headaches.

name: Butamben
description: Butamben is a local anesthetic used to relieve pain and itching from minor burns, insect bites, or skin irritations. It blocks nerve signals in the body.

name: Butobarbital
description: Butobarbital is a barbiturate derivative used as a sedative and hypnotic. It is employed for its central nervous system depressant effects to induce sleep or reduce anxiety.

name: Butoconazole
description: Butoconazole is an imidazole antifungal agent primarily used to treat vulvovaginal candidiasis (yeast infections). It works by inhibiting the growth of fungi.

name: Butylscopolamine
description: Butylscopolamine (also known as hyoscine butylbromide) is an antispasmodic agent used to relieve cramps and spasms of the gastrointestinal tract, bladder, and bile duct. It works by relaxing smooth muscles.

name: Calcifediol
description: Calcifediol is a vitamin D analog used to treat secondary hyperparathyroidism in patients with chronic kidney disease on dialysis. It helps regulate calcium and phosphate levels.

name: Camazepam
description: A benzodiazepine derivative used for the short-term treatment of anxiety disorders.

name: Candesartan Cilexetil
description: An angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) prodrug used to treat hypertension and heart failure.

name: Cangrelor
description: An intravenous direct-acting P2Y12 platelet inhibitor used to reduce thrombotic events in patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention.

name: Cannabidiol
description: A non-psychoactive cannabinoid used to treat seizures associated with specific epilepsy syndromes like Lennox-Gastaut syndrome and Dravet syndrome.

name: Canrenoic Acid
description: An active metabolite of spironolactone and an aldosterone antagonist, used to manage conditions associated with excessive aldosterone such as ascites and edema.

name: Captodiame
description: A non-benzodiazepine anxiolytic and muscle relaxant used to alleviate anxiety and muscle tension.

name: Carbamoylcholine
description: A cholinergic agonist used topically to induce miosis during ophthalmic surgery or to reduce intraocular pressure in glaucoma.

name: Carbinoxamine
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis, such as sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes.

name: Carboprost Tromethamine
description: A prostaglandin analog used to induce abortion in the second trimester and to control refractory postpartum hemorrhage.

name: Carprofen
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) primarily used in veterinary medicine for pain and inflammation relief in dogs.

name: Carteolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenergic blocker used topically to reduce intraocular pressure in glaucoma and ocular hypertension. Systemically, it treats hypertension and angina pectoris.

name: Cation
description: A general chemical term referring to a positively charged ion, not a specific pharmaceutical composition with direct clinical use.

name: Cefacetrile
description: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections susceptible to its action.

name: Cefaloridine
description: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used for treating bacterial infections, active against susceptible Gram-positive and some Gram-negative bacteria.

name: Cefalotin
description: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory tract, skin, and urinary tract.

name: Cefamandole
description: A second-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections of the respiratory tract, urinary tract, skin, and bones.

name: Cefapirin
description: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used for treating susceptible bacterial infections, including skin and soft tissue, respiratory, and urinary tract infections, and for surgical prophylaxis.

name: Cefmenoxime
description: A third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat serious bacterial infections such as lower respiratory tract, urinary tract, and intra-abdominal infections.

name: Cefmetazole
description: A cephamycin antibiotic effective against aerobic and anaerobic bacteria, primarily used for surgical prophylaxis and treatment of intra-abdominal and gynecological infections.

name: Cefonicid
description: A second-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections of the lower respiratory tract, urinary tract, skin and soft tissue, and bone and joint, and for surgical prophylaxis.

name: Ceforanide
description: Ceforanide is a second-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory tract, urinary tract, and skin, and for surgical prophylaxis.

name: Cefotetan
description: Cefotetan is a second-generation cephamycin antibiotic effective against a broad spectrum of bacteria, including anaerobes, used for surgical prophylaxis and treating intra-abdominal and gynecological infections.

name: Cefotiam
description: Cefotiam is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, such as those affecting the respiratory and urinary tracts, skin, and soft tissues.

name: Cefoxitin
description: Cefoxitin is a second-generation cephamycin antibiotic effective against a wide range of bacteria, including anaerobes, used for surgical prophylaxis and the treatment of intra-abdominal and gynecological infections.

name: Cefpiramide
description: Cefpiramide is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat serious bacterial infections, including septicemia, pneumonia, and complicated urinary tract infections.

name: Cefpodoxime
description: Cefpodoxime is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections of the respiratory tract, urinary tract, and skin.

name: Cefradine
description: Cefradine is a first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic effective against various Gram-positive and some Gram-negative bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory and urinary tracts.

name: Ceftobiprole
description: Ceftobiprole is a fifth-generation cephalosporin antibiotic with activity against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, used for complicated skin and soft tissue infections.

name: Cephaloglycin
description: Cephaloglycin is an oral first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic, historically used for treating urinary tract infections.

name: Cerulenin
description: Cerulenin is an antifungal antibiotic that inhibits fatty acid synthesis. It is investigated for its antimicrobial properties and potential as an anticancer agent.

name: Cevimeline
description: A muscarinic agonist used to treat symptoms of dry mouth (xerostomia) in patients with Sjgren's syndrome by increasing saliva secretion.

name: Chenodeoxycholic Acid
description: A primary bile acid used to dissolve cholesterol gallstones or to treat specific liver disorders like primary biliary cholangitis.

name: Chloral
description: A compound known for its hypnotic and sedative properties, historically used to induce sleep or calm agitation.

name: Chloropyramine
description: A first-generation antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic reactions such as rhinitis, urticaria, and conjunctivitis.

name: Chlorothiazide
description: A thiazide diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema by increasing the excretion of sodium and water from the body.

name: Chloroxine
description: An antimicrobial agent primarily used topically to treat skin infections, including those caused by fungi and bacteria. It functions as an antiseptic and antifungal.

name: Chloroxylenol
description: A broad-spectrum antimicrobial compound used as an antiseptic and disinfectant. It is commonly found in surgical scrubs, skin cleansers, and household disinfectants.

name: Chlorphenesin
description: An antifungal and antibacterial agent, often used as a preservative in cosmetics and topical medications. It also has muscle relaxant properties, though less commonly used systemically for this purpose.

name: Chlorprothixene
description: A typical antipsychotic medication used to manage psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia and the manic phase of bipolar disorder. It helps reduce symptoms like hallucinations and delusions.

name: Chlortetracycline
description: A broad-spectrum tetracycline antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis, making it effective against a range of gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria.

name: Cholecalciferol
description: Used to treat or prevent vitamin D deficiency, osteomalacia, and rickets. It aids in the absorption of calcium and phosphorus for bone health.

name: Cholic Acid
description: Used to treat bile acid synthesis disorders due to single enzyme defects and peroxisomal disorders by replacing deficient primary bile acids.

name: Choline Trisalicylate
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve mild to moderate pain, fever, and inflammation, often associated with arthritis.

name: Cidofovir
description: An antiviral medication primarily used for the treatment of cytomegalovirus (CMV) retinitis in patients with AIDS.

name: Cilazapril
description: An ACE inhibitor used to treat essential hypertension (high blood pressure) and congestive heart failure.

name: Cinchocaine
description: A local anesthetic used topically to relieve pain, itching, and discomfort caused by conditions such as hemorrhoids or minor skin irritations.

name: Cinoxacin
description: A quinolone antibiotic primarily used to treat acute and chronic urinary tract infections caused by susceptible bacteria.

name: Clenbuterol
description: A beta-2 adrenergic agonist used as a bronchodilator to treat respiratory conditions like asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Clevidipine
