description: An intravenous dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used for the rapid reduction of blood pressure in hypertensive emergencies.

name: Clocortolone
description: A topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation, itching, and redness associated with various skin conditions such as eczema and dermatitis.

name: Clodronic Acid
description: A bisphosphonate used to inhibit bone resorption, primarily in the management of hypercalcemia of malignancy and osteolytic bone metastases.

name: Clofibrate
description: A fibric acid derivative used to lower elevated serum triglyceride and cholesterol levels, particularly in hyperlipidemias.

name: Clomifene
description: A selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) used to induce ovulation in anovulatory women with intact hypothalamic-pituitary function, often for fertility treatment.

name: Clomocycline
description: A tetracycline antibiotic used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory, urinary, and gastrointestinal tracts.

name: Clonixin
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) primarily used for its analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects in the treatment of various pain conditions.

name: Clorazepic Acid
description: A benzodiazepine anxiolytic used to treat anxiety disorders, acute alcohol withdrawal, and as an adjunctive treatment for partial seizures.

name: Clotiazepam
description: A thienodiazepine with anxiolytic, sedative, and muscle relaxant properties, primarily used for anxiety disorders and insomnia.

name: Cloxazolam
description: A benzodiazepine derivative used for the short-term treatment of anxiety disorders and psychosomatic illnesses with associated anxiety.

name: Cobicistat
description: A pharmacokinetic enhancer that inhibits CYP3A, used to boost the plasma levels of co-administered antiretroviral drugs in HIV treatment.

name: Cobimetinib
description: A MEK inhibitor used in combination with other agents for the treatment of BRAF V600 mutation-positive unresectable or metastatic melanoma.

name: Cocaine
description: A potent local anesthetic and vasoconstrictor, sometimes used topically for anesthesia of mucous membranes in diagnostic or surgical procedures of the nose, throat, and larynx.

name: Colistin
description: A polymyxin antibiotic used to treat severe infections caused by multi-drug resistant Gram-negative bacteria, including Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: Copanlisib
description: A phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3K) inhibitor used for the treatment of adult patients with relapsed follicular lymphoma who have received at least two prior systemic therapies.

name: Corticorelin Ovine Triflutate
description: A synthetic ovine corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) used as a diagnostic agent to differentiate between pituitary-dependent Cushing's disease and ectopic ACTH syndrome.

name: Cortisone Acetate
description: A synthetic corticosteroid with anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive properties, used in the treatment of adrenal insufficiency and various inflammatory or allergic conditions.

name: Crisaborole
description: Crisaborole is a non-steroidal phosphodiesterase-4 inhibitor applied topically for the treatment of mild to moderate atopic dermatitis.

name: Cyamemazine
description: Cyamemazine is a phenothiazine antipsychotic with sedative and anxiolytic properties, used to manage psychomotor agitation and certain psychotic disorders.

name: Cyclacillin
description: Cyclacillin is an aminopenicillin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, particularly those of the respiratory tract, urinary tract, and skin.

name: Cyclizine
description: Cyclizine is an antihistamine with antiemetic properties, used for the prevention and treatment of nausea, vomiting, and dizziness, especially from motion sickness.

name: Cyclosporine
description: Cyclosporine is an immunosuppressant calcineurin inhibitor used to prevent organ rejection in transplant recipients and to treat certain autoimmune conditions.

name: Cyclothiazide
description: A thiazide diuretic used to manage hypertension and fluid retention (edema) associated with various conditions.

name: Cyproterone Acetate
description: An antiandrogen and progestogen used to treat androgen-dependent conditions such as prostate cancer, severe hirsutism, and acne.

name: Cysteamine
description: An aminothiol used to reduce cystine accumulation in various organs in patients with nephropathic cystinosis.

name: Dabrafenib
description: A BRAF kinase inhibitor used to treat specific cancers, including melanoma and non-small cell lung cancer, that have a BRAF V600E mutation.

name: Dalfopristin
description: A streptogramin antibiotic component typically used in combination with quinupristin to treat serious infections caused by multidrug-resistant Gram-positive bacteria.

name: Dantrolene
description: A direct-acting skeletal muscle relaxant used to treat spasticity associated with neurological disorders and as a specific antidote for malignant hyperthermia.

name: Dapiprazole
description: An alpha-1 adrenergic antagonist used topically to reverse pharmacologically induced mydriasis following ophthalmic examination.

name: Dasabuvir
description: A non-nucleoside NS5B polymerase inhibitor used in combination with other direct-acting antivirals to treat chronic hepatitis C virus genotype 1 infection.

name: Debrisoquine
description: An adrenergic neuron blocking antihypertensive agent, primarily used as a probe drug for assessing cytochrome P450 2D6 metabolic capacity.

name: Decamethonium
description: A depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent used to induce skeletal muscle relaxation, often for surgical procedures or mechanical ventilation.

name: Delafloxacin
description: A fluoroquinolone antibacterial agent used for the treatment of acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections (ABSSSI).

name: Delavirdine
description: A non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) used in combination with other antiretroviral agents for the treatment of HIV-1 infection.

name: Delorazepam
description: A benzodiazepine derivative with anxiolytic, sedative, and hypnotic properties, used for the short-term treatment of anxiety or insomnia.

name: Demecarium
description: A long-acting cholinesterase inhibitor used topically to treat glaucoma by reducing intraocular pressure and in the management of accommodative esotropia.

name: Deoxycholic Acid
description: A cytolytic agent, administered by injection, used to improve the appearance of submental fullness (double chin) by destroying fat cells.

name: Deserpidine
description: An antihypertensive and antipsychotic agent, used to treat mild to moderate hypertension and for symptomatic relief of severe neuropsychiatric conditions.

name: Desflurane
description: A volatile inhaled anesthetic used for induction and maintenance of general anesthesia during surgical procedures.

name: Desipramine
description: A tricyclic antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder. It can also be used for neuropathic pain and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

name: Deslanoside
description: A cardiac glycoside used for rapid digitalization in congestive heart failure and atrial fibrillation to improve myocardial contractility.

name: Deutetrabenazine
description: A VMAT2 inhibitor used to treat chorea associated with Huntington's disease and tardive dyskinesia.

name: Dexbrompheniramine
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergies, hay fever, and the common cold, such as sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes.

name: Dexchlorpheniramine Maleate
description: An antihistamine used to treat symptoms of allergic reactions, including sneezing, runny nose, watery eyes, and itching.

name: Dexfenfluramine
description: A serotonin-releasing agent previously used as an appetite suppressant for the management of obesity.

name: Dexmethylphenidate
description: A central nervous system stimulant used in the treatment of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy, to improve focus and reduce impulsivity.

name: Dexrazoxane
description: A cardioprotective agent used to reduce the incidence and severity of cardiotoxicity associated with doxorubicin chemotherapy, and to treat anthracycline extravasation.

name: Dextroamphetamine
description: A central nervous system stimulant used in the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.

name: Dezocine
description: An opioid analgesic primarily used for the management of moderate to severe pain.

name: Di Phosphate
description: Refers to inorganic phosphate anions (e.g., HPO4^2-, H2PO4^-) commonly formulated as salts in pharmaceutical preparations for buffering or as a source of phosphate.

name: Diamorphine
description: A potent opioid analgesic used for the relief of severe pain, particularly in palliative care.

name: Diclofenamide
description: A carbonic anhydrase inhibitor used as a diuretic and in the treatment of glaucoma to reduce intraocular pressure.

name: Dicoumarol
description: Dicoumarol is an oral anticoagulant that inhibits vitamin K-dependent clotting factor synthesis, used to prevent and treat thromboembolic disorders.

name: Dienestrol
description: Dienestrol is a synthetic nonsteroidal estrogen used topically for the treatment of atrophic vaginitis associated with estrogen deficiency.

name: Diethylpropion
description: Diethylpropion is a sympathomimetic amine used as an appetite suppressant for the short-term management of exogenous obesity.

name: Diethylstilbestrol
description: Diethylstilbestrol is a synthetic nonsteroidal estrogen historically used to treat certain hormone-dependent cancers, but its use is now highly restricted due to safety concerns.

name: Difenoxin
description: Difenoxin is an opioid derivative used in combination with atropine as an antidiarrheal agent to reduce gastrointestinal motility.

name: Diflorasone
description: A high-potency topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation, itching, and redness in various skin conditions such as psoriasis and eczema.

name: Diflunisal
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for pain relief and to reduce inflammation in conditions like osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.

name: Difluocortolone
description: A potent topical corticosteroid used to treat inflammatory skin conditions, including severe eczema and psoriasis, by reducing inflammation and itching.

name: Digitoxin
description: A cardiac glycoside used in the treatment of heart failure to improve cardiac contractility and in certain arrhythmias to control ventricular rate.

name: Dihydrocodeine
description: An opioid analgesic used for the relief of moderate to severe pain. It is also used as an antitussive to suppress cough.

name: Dihydroergotamine
description: An ergot alkaloid derivative primarily used for the acute treatment of migraine attacks and cluster headaches by constricting blood vessels.

name: Dihydrotachysterol
description: A synthetic vitamin D analog used to treat hypocalcemia due to hypoparathyroidism and pseudohypoparathyroidism, helping to regulate calcium and phosphate levels.

name: Dimetacrine
description: A tricyclic antidepressant with anxiolytic properties, historically used in the management of depressive disorders.

name: Dimethyl Sulfoxide
description: A solvent with anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties, used topically for pain relief and as an intravesical solution for interstitial cystitis.

name: Dimetindene
description: An antihistamine with anticholinergic properties, used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis, such as sneezing and runny nose, and various itchy skin conditions like urticaria.

name: Dimetotiazine
description: A phenothiazine derivative with antihistaminic and antiemetic properties, used to treat allergic reactions and nausea/vomiting.

name: Dinoprost Tromethamine
description: A prostaglandin F2 alpha analogue used to induce labor, ripen the cervix, or induce therapeutic abortion.

name: Dipivefrin
description: A prodrug of epinephrine used as an ophthalmic solution to reduce intraocular pressure in open-angle glaucoma and ocular hypertension.

name: Dirithromycin
description: A macrolide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, particularly those affecting the respiratory tract and skin.

name: Ditazole
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that also exhibits antiplatelet activity, used for its anti-inflammatory effects and to inhibit blood clotting.

name: Doconexent
description: An omega-3 fatty acid, also known as DHA, used as a nutritional supplement for supporting cognitive function, eye health, and infant development.

name: Dofetilide
description: A Class III antiarrhythmic agent used to maintain normal sinus rhythm in patients with atrial fibrillation or flutter, or to convert these arrhythmias.

name: Dolasetron
description: A 5-HT3 receptor antagonist used for the prevention of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting and postoperative nausea and vomiting.

name: Dotatate Gallium Ga 68
description: A radiopharmaceutical agent used for diagnostic imaging (PET scan) to localize somatostatin receptor-positive neuroendocrine tumors.

name: Doxacurium
description: A long-acting non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocker used as an adjunct to general anesthesia to facilitate tracheal intubation and provide skeletal muscle relaxation.

name: Doxercalciferol
description: A synthetic vitamin D analog used to treat secondary hyperparathyroidism in patients undergoing chronic kidney dialysis.

name: Dronabinol
description: A synthetic cannabinoid used to treat anorexia associated with weight loss in AIDS patients and chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting refractory to conventional antiemetics.

name: Droperidol
description: A butyrophenone antipsychotic with antiemetic properties, primarily used for the management of postoperative nausea and vomiting and as a tranquilizer for neuroleptanalgesia.

name: Droxicam
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) of the oxicam class, used for its anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antipyretic properties in the treatment of various inflammatory and painful conditions.

name: Droxidopa
description: A synthetic amino acid precursor to norepinephrine, used to treat symptomatic neurogenic orthostatic hypotension (nOH) by increasing systemic blood pressure.

name: Dyclonine
description: A topical anesthetic used to relieve pain and discomfort, particularly in the mouth and throat.

name: Dyphylline
description: A bronchodilator used to relax the smooth muscles of the bronchial airways, improving breathing in conditions like asthma or COPD.

name: Ecabet
description: A gastric mucosal protectant used in the treatment of gastric ulcers by promoting protective mechanisms of the gastric mucosa.

name: Echothiophate
description: An irreversible cholinesterase inhibitor used as an ophthalmic solution to treat certain types of glaucoma and accommodative esotropia.

name: Edetic Acid
description: A chelating agent used to treat heavy metal poisoning by binding to metal ions, and also as an anticoagulant in blood collection.

name: Edoxaban
description: An anticoagulant that directly inhibits factor Xa, used to prevent and treat venous thromboembolism and to reduce the risk of stroke in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation.

name: Edrophonium
description: A short-acting acetylcholinesterase inhibitor used primarily in the diagnosis of myasthenia gravis and to reverse the effects of nondepolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents.

name: Efinaconazole
description: A topical antifungal agent used to treat onychomycosis of the toenails by inhibiting fungal ergosterol synthesis.

name: Elbasvir
description: A direct-acting antiviral that inhibits the hepatitis C virus (HCV) NS5A protein, used in combination with other antivirals to treat chronic HCV infection.

name: Eliglustat
description: A glucosylceramide synthase inhibitor used as an oral substrate reduction therapy for adults with Gaucher disease type 1.

name: Eluxadoline
description: An opioid receptor agonist and antagonist used to treat irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea (IBS-D) by acting locally in the gut.

name: Elvitegravir
description: An integrase strand transfer inhibitor (INSTI) used in combination with other antiretroviral agents to treat HIV-1 infection.

name: Emedastine
description: A topical H1 receptor antagonist used as an ophthalmic solution to relieve symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis.

name: Enasidenib
description: An isocitrate dehydrogenase-2 (IDH2) inhibitor used to treat relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML) with an IDH2 mutation.

name: Encainide
description: A Class IC antiarrhythmic agent previously used to treat life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias, but its use is limited due to proarrhythmic risks.

name: Enflurane
description: A halogenated ether used as an inhaled general anesthetic for the induction and maintenance of anesthesia during surgical procedures.

name: Enoxacin
description: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, primarily those of the urinary tract.

name: Enviomycin
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used as a second-line agent in the treatment of multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

name: Epinephrine
description: A potent alpha- and beta-adrenergic agonist used as an emergency treatment for severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis), cardiac arrest, and acute asthma attacks.

name: Epirizole
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) with anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antipyretic properties, historically used for pain and inflammation.

name: Epoprostenol
description: Epoprostenol is a potent vasodilator and inhibitor of platelet aggregation used to treat primary pulmonary hypertension and to prevent platelet aggregation during renal dialysis.

name: Equilin
description: Equilin is an estrogen found in conjugated estrogen preparations, primarily used in hormone replacement therapy to manage menopausal symptoms and prevent postmenopausal osteoporosis.

name: Ergocalciferol
description: Ergocalciferol (Vitamin D2) is a vitamin D analogue used to treat and prevent vitamin D deficiency, hypoparathyroidism, and certain metabolic bone diseases.

name: Ergometrine
description: Ergometrine is an ergot alkaloid that causes uterine contractions, primarily used to prevent and treat postpartum and post-abortion hemorrhage.

name: Eribulin
description: Eribulin is a microtubule dynamics inhibitor used as a chemotherapy agent for the treatment of metastatic breast cancer and unresectable or metastatic liposarcoma.

name: Erythrityl Tetranitrate
description: A long-acting nitrate vasodilator used for the prevention and treatment of angina pectoris.

name: Eslicarbazepine Acetate
description: An antiepileptic drug indicated for the treatment of partial-onset seizures in adults and children.

name: Estazolam
description: A benzodiazepine hypnotic primarily used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.

name: Estrone
description: An estrogen used in hormone replacement therapy to alleviate menopausal symptoms and treat estrogen deficiency conditions.

name: Estrone Sulfate
description: A conjugated estrogen used for hormone replacement therapy to manage menopausal symptoms and treat certain conditions caused by estrogen deficiency.

name: Etacrynic Acid
description: A potent loop diuretic used to treat edema associated with congestive heart failure, renal impairment, and hepatic cirrhosis, by inhibiting sodium reabsorption in the ascending loop of Henle.

name: Ethanol
description: Used as an antidote for methanol or ethylene glycol poisoning, competing for alcohol dehydrogenase. It also serves as a solvent in many pharmaceutical preparations.

name: Ethanolamine Oleate
description: A sclerosing agent primarily used for the intraluminal treatment of esophageal varices by inducing inflammatory responses and fibrosis, leading to variceal obliteration.

name: Ethchlorvynol
description: A sedative-hypnotic agent formerly used for the short-term treatment of insomnia due to its central nervous system depressant effects.

name: Ethinylestradiol
description: A synthetic estrogen component widely used in oral contraceptive pills and hormone replacement therapy to prevent ovulation and manage menopausal symptoms.

name: Ethosuximide
description: An anticonvulsant medication primarily used in the treatment of absence seizures (petit mal epilepsy). It works by reducing the frequency of abnormal electrical impulses in the brain.

name: Ethotoin
description: A hydantoin derivative anticonvulsant used for the management of generalized tonic-clonic seizures and complex partial seizures. It acts to stabilize neuronal membranes and reduce seizure activity.

name: Ethyl Loflazepate
description: A benzodiazepine derivative with anxiolytic, anticonvulsant, sedative, and muscle relaxant properties. It is used in the treatment of anxiety disorders and as an adjunctive treatment for epilepsy.

name: Ethynodiol Diacetate
description: A synthetic progestin hormone used in combination with an estrogen as an oral contraceptive to prevent pregnancy. It functions by inhibiting ovulation and altering the cervical mucus and endometrium.

name: Etidocaine
description: A long-acting local anesthetic of the amide type, used for regional nerve blocks, epidural anesthesia, and infiltration anesthesia. It provides prolonged pain relief by blocking nerve impulse conduction.

name: Etidronic Acid
description: A bisphosphonate used to inhibit bone resorption in conditions such as Paget's disease, heterotopic ossification, and hypercalcemia of malignancy.

name: Etofenamate
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) primarily used topically to relieve pain and inflammation in musculoskeletal disorders.

name: Etofibrate
description: A lipid-lowering agent from the fibrate class, used to treat dyslipidemia by reducing elevated triglycerides and total cholesterol.

name: Etravirine
description: A non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) used in combination with other antiretrovirals to treat HIV-1 infection, particularly in treatment-experienced patients.

name: Ezogabine
description: An antiepileptic drug that acts as a neuronal potassium channel opener, used as adjunctive therapy for partial-onset seizures in adults.

name: Felbamate
description: An antiepileptic drug primarily used for the treatment of partial seizures and seizures associated with Lennox-Gastaut syndrome.

name: Fenbufen
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce pain, inflammation, and stiffness, commonly in conditions like rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.

name: Fencamfamin
description: A central nervous system stimulant historically used to combat fatigue and improve alertness. It has also been explored for its anorectic properties.

name: Fenofibric Acid
description: The active metabolite of fenofibrate, used to reduce elevated triglyceride levels and increase HDL-C in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia or mixed dyslipidemia.

name: Fenoldopam
description: A selective dopamine D1 receptor agonist used intravenously to treat severe hypertension by inducing vasodilation and promoting natriuresis.

name: Fenoprofen
description: Fenoprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve mild to moderate pain, and to treat signs and symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.

name: Fenoterol
description: Fenoterol is a short-acting beta-2 adrenergic receptor agonist used as a bronchodilator to relieve bronchospasm in conditions such as asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Ferric Pyrophosphate
description: Ferric pyrophosphate is an iron salt used as an iron supplement to treat or prevent iron deficiency anemia, often in food fortification or intravenous preparations for chronic kidney disease.

name: Fesoterodine
description: Fesoterodine is an antimuscarinic agent used to treat symptoms of overactive bladder (OAB), such as urinary urgency, frequency, and urge incontinence.

name: Fidaxomicin
description: Fidaxomicin is a macrolide antibiotic used specifically for the treatment of Clostridioides difficile infection (CDI) in adults.

name: Finafloxacin
description: A fluoroquinolone antibacterial agent used for the treatment of acute otitis externa caused by susceptible strains of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus.

name: Fleroxacin
description: A broad-spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory and urinary tracts.

name: Flibanserin
description: A serotonin 1A receptor agonist and 2A receptor antagonist used to treat premenopausal women with acquired, generalized hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD).

name: Floctafenine
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) with analgesic properties, used for the short-term treatment of acute pain.

name: Floxuridine
description: A pyrimidine antimetabolite used as a chemotherapeutic agent, primarily in the palliative treatment of gastrointestinal adenocarcinomas metastatic to the liver.

name: Flubendazole
description: An anthelmintic medication used to treat various parasitic worm infections, including those caused by roundworms, whipworms, and pinworms.

name: Fluciclovine
description: A radioactive diagnostic agent used in positron emission tomography (PET) imaging to detect and localize recurrent prostate cancer.

name: Fludiazepam
description: A benzodiazepine derivative with anxiolytic, sedative, and hypnotic properties, used to treat anxiety disorders or insomnia.

name: Flumethasone
description: A synthetic corticosteroid used topically to reduce inflammation and itching associated with various skin conditions like eczema or dermatitis.

name: Flunisolide
description: A synthetic corticosteroid primarily used as an inhaled medication to manage asthma and as a nasal spray to treat symptoms of allergic rhinitis.

name: Flunitrazepam
description: A potent benzodiazepine derivative with strong sedative-hypnotic, anxiolytic, anticonvulsant, and muscle relaxant properties, historically used for severe insomnia.

name: Fluocinonide
description: A high-potency topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation, itching, and redness associated with various dermatoses such as eczema and psoriasis.

name: Fluocortolone
description: A moderately potent topical corticosteroid used for the symptomatic treatment of inflammatory skin conditions and in combination products for hemorrhoidal discomfort.

name: Fluoxymesterone
description: An anabolic-androgenic steroid used in men for testosterone replacement therapy in cases of deficient endogenous testosterone and sometimes in women for metastatic breast cancer.

name: Fluprednidene
description: A synthetic corticosteroid primarily used topically to alleviate inflammation, redness, and itching associated with various inflammatory and pruritic dermatoses.

name: Flurandrenolide
description: A topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation, itching, and redness associated with various skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis.

name: Fluspirilene
description: A long-acting injectable first-generation antipsychotic used for the maintenance treatment of chronic schizophrenia.

name: Fomepizole
description: An alcohol dehydrogenase inhibitor used as an antidote in the treatment of methanol or ethylene glycol poisoning.

name: Formestane
description: An irreversible aromatase inhibitor used in the treatment of estrogen-receptor positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women.

name: Fosamprenavir
description: A prodrug of amprenavir, an antiretroviral protease inhibitor used in combination therapy for the treatment of HIV-1 infection.

name: Foscarnet
description: An antiviral agent used for the treatment of cytomegalovirus (CMV) retinitis in AIDS patients and acyclovir-resistant herpes simplex virus (HSV) infections.

name: Fospropofol
description: A prodrug of propofol, it is used for the induction and maintenance of sedation in adult patients undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic procedures.

name: Frovatriptan
description: A selective serotonin 5-HT1B/1D receptor agonist used for the acute treatment of migraine attacks, with or without aura.

name: Fusafungine
description: An antibiotic and antifungal agent previously used as a topical treatment for infections of the upper respiratory tract.

name: Gabapentin Enacarbil
description: A prodrug of gabapentin, it is indicated for the treatment of moderate-to-severe primary restless legs syndrome and postherpetic neuralgia.

name: Gadobenic Acid
description: A gadolinium-based contrast agent used in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to enhance visualization and characterization of focal liver lesions.

name: Gadoxetic Acid
description: A gadolinium-based MRI contrast agent primarily used for dynamic and hepatobiliary phase imaging to detect and characterize focal liver lesions.

name: Gallamine Triethiodide
description: A non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent used as an adjunct to general anesthesia to induce skeletal muscle relaxation during surgery.

name: Gallium Nitrate
description: An antineoplastic agent used to treat symptomatic hypercalcemia of malignancy that is unresponsive to adequate hydration.

name: Gamma Hydroxybutyric Acid
description: A central nervous system depressant approved for the treatment of narcolepsy with cataplexy and excessive daytime sleepiness.

name: Gemeprost
description: A prostaglandin E1 analogue used to induce labor or abortion, and to dilate the cervix prior to surgical procedures.

name: Gestrinone
description: A synthetic steroid with antiprogestogenic and androgenic properties, used in the treatment of endometriosis and uterine fibroids.

name: Glecaprevir
description: A protease inhibitor used in combination with other direct-acting antivirals for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

name: Gliquidone
description: An oral sulfonylurea antidiabetic drug used to lower blood glucose levels by stimulating insulin secretion in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

name: Glisoxepide
description: An oral sulfonylurea antidiabetic drug used to stimulate insulin release from pancreatic beta cells to lower blood glucose in type 2 diabetes.

name: Glubionate Anhydrous
description: A calcium salt used as a dietary supplement to prevent or treat calcium deficiencies, such as in osteoporosis or hypocalcemia.

name: Glucoheptonate
description: Often found as ferric glucoheptonate, an iron complex administered intravenously for the treatment of iron deficiency anemia in adult patients.

name: Glutamic Acid
description: An amino acid and an excitatory neurotransmitter precursor in the central nervous system, also used as a dietary supplement.

name: Glutethimide
description: A non-barbiturate sedative-hypnotic medication historically used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.

name: Glyburide
description: An oral sulfonylurea antidiabetic drug used to lower blood glucose levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus by stimulating insulin secretion.

name: Glycerol Phenylbutyrate
description: An ammonia scavenger used to manage elevated ammonia levels in patients with urea cycle disorders.

name: Glycopyrronium
description: An anticholinergic agent used to reduce excessive salivation (sialorrhea) and as a bronchodilator in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Goserelin
description: A synthetic gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) analog used in the treatment of prostate cancer, breast cancer, endometriosis, and uterine fibroids.

name: Grazoprevir
description: A direct-acting antiviral agent, specifically an NS3/4A protease inhibitor, used in combination therapy to treat chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

name: Guanabenz
description: An alpha-2 adrenergic agonist primarily used to treat hypertension by reducing sympathetic outflow from the central nervous system.

name: Guanadrel
description: An anti-adrenergic antihypertensive agent primarily used to treat essential hypertension, it acts by depleting neuronal norepinephrine stores and inhibiting its release.

name: Guanethidine
description: An anti-adrenergic antihypertensive agent used to treat moderate to severe hypertension, it works by inhibiting the release of norepinephrine from sympathetic nerve endings.

name: Guanfacine
description: A selective alpha-2A adrenergic agonist used to treat hypertension and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), it reduces sympathetic nerve outflow from the central nervous system.

name: Halazepam
description: A benzodiazepine derivative used for the short-term management of anxiety disorders, it exerts its anxiolytic effects by enhancing GABAergic neurotransmission.

name: Halcinonide
description: A potent topical corticosteroid used to treat inflammatory and pruritic manifestations of corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses, such as psoriasis and eczema.

name: Halofantrine
description: An antimalarial drug used in the treatment of malaria, particularly effective against chloroquine-sensitive and some resistant strains of Plasmodium falciparum.

name: Haloprogin
description: A topical antifungal medication applied to the skin to treat superficial fungal infections such as tinea pedis (athlete's foot) and tinea cruris (jock itch).

name: Hesperetin
description: A bioflavonoid with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, often included in dietary supplements for general health support.

name: Hexaminolevulinate
description: Used as a photosensitizer in photodynamic diagnosis for the detection of bladder cancer and in photodynamic therapy for certain skin lesions.

name: Hexetidine
description: An antiseptic and antifungal agent commonly used in mouthwashes and gargles to treat oral and pharyngeal infections like gingivitis and sore throat.

name: Hexobarbital
description: Hexobarbital is a short-acting barbiturate that was historically used as an intravenous anesthetic and hypnotic agent to induce sleep. Its use is now largely superseded by newer agents.

name: Hexoprenaline
description: Hexoprenaline is a beta-2 adrenergic receptor agonist used as a tocolytic to inhibit premature labor and as a bronchodilator in the treatment of asthma and COPD.

name: Hexylresorcinol
description: Hexylresorcinol is an antiseptic agent used in throat lozenges to relieve sore throat pain and as an anthelmintic for the treatment of certain parasitic worm infections.

name: Histamine
description: Histamine is an endogenous compound involved in immune responses and as a neurotransmitter; it is used diagnostically to assess gastric acid secretion or bronchial hyperreactivity.

name: Histrelin
description: Histrelin is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonist used to treat central precocious puberty, prostate cancer, and endometriosis by suppressing sex hormone production.

name: Hydrocodone
description: An opioid analgesic used for the management of moderate to severe pain and as an antitussive to suppress cough.

name: Hydrocortamate
description: A topical corticosteroid used to alleviate inflammation, itching, and redness associated with various dermatological conditions.

name: Hydromorphone
description: A potent opioid analgesic used to manage moderate to severe pain, particularly in patients who require continuous, around-the-clock opioid analgesia.

name: Hydroxyamphetamine
description: An indirect-acting sympathomimetic agent used topically in ophthalmology as a mydriatic to dilate the pupil for diagnostic examinations.

name: Hydroxyprogesterone Caproate
description: A progestin indicated to reduce the risk of recurrent spontaneous preterm birth in women with a history of singleton spontaneous preterm birth.

name: Ibandronate
description: A bisphosphonate used for the treatment and prevention of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women and for treating hypercalcemia of malignancy.

name: Ibudilast
description: A phosphodiesterase inhibitor used in Japan for the treatment of bronchial asthma and post-stroke dizziness.

name: Icatibant
description: A bradykinin B2 receptor antagonist used for the on-demand treatment of acute attacks of hereditary angioedema (HAE).

name: Icosapent Ethyl
description: A highly purified omega-3 fatty acid ethyl ester used to reduce the risk of cardiovascular events in adults with elevated triglycerides on statin therapy.

name: Icotinib
description: An EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used for the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with activating EGFR mutations.

name: Idelalisib
description: A phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3K) delta inhibitor used to treat certain B-cell malignancies, including relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia and follicular lymphoma.

name: Ifenprodil
description: An N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonist primarily studied for its potential in neurological conditions and cerebral vasospasm.

name: Iloprost
description: A synthetic prostacyclin analog used to treat severe primary pulmonary hypertension and critical limb ischemia by causing vasodilation and inhibiting platelet aggregation.

name: Imatinib
description: A tyrosine kinase inhibitor used to treat chronic myeloid leukemia (CML), gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GIST), and other Philadelphia chromosome-positive leukemias.

name: Imidafenacin
description: A muscarinic receptor antagonist used to treat symptoms of overactive bladder, such as urinary frequency, urgency, and urge incontinence.

name: Iobenguane
description: A radiopharmaceutical used for diagnostic imaging and targeted radionuclide therapy of certain neuroendocrine tumors, such as pheochromocytoma and neuroblastoma.

name: Iodide 131
description: A radioactive isotope of iodine used diagnostically for thyroid uptake studies and therapeutically for the ablation of thyroid tissue in hyperthyroidism and differentiated thyroid cancer.

name: Iodipamide
description: An iodinated contrast agent historically used for radiologic visualization of the biliary system, including the gallbladder and bile ducts.

name: Iodixanol
description: A non-ionic, iso-osmolar iodinated contrast agent used for radiographic imaging to enhance visualization of blood vessels, organs, and other body structures in procedures like CT scans and angiography.

name: Ioflupane 123
description: A radiopharmaceutical used in SPECT imaging to visualize dopamine transporters in the brain, aiding in the differential diagnosis of Parkinsonian syndromes from essential tremor.

name: Ioversol
description: Ioversol is a non-ionic, iodinated contrast agent used to enhance visualization in diagnostic angiographic and urographic procedures.

name: Ioxilan
description: Ioxilan is a non-ionic, low-osmolar iodinated contrast agent used for visualization in diagnostic imaging, particularly in angiography and CT scans.

name: Isavuconazonium
description: Isavuconazonium is a prodrug of isavuconazole, an azole antifungal agent used to treat severe invasive fungal infections like aspergillosis and mucormycosis.

name: Isocarboxazid
description: Isocarboxazid is a non-selective monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) used as an antidepressant for the treatment of major depressive disorder.

name: Isoconazole
description: Isoconazole is an imidazole antifungal agent used topically to treat superficial fungal skin infections and vulvovaginal candidiasis.

name: Isoetharine
description: A short-acting beta-adrenergic agonist used as a bronchodilator for the treatment of bronchospasm associated with asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

name: Isoflurophate
description: An irreversible cholinesterase inhibitor primarily used topically in the eye to reduce intraocular pressure in chronic open-angle glaucoma.

name: Isometheptene
description: A sympathomimetic amine with vasoconstrictive properties, used for the relief of vascular headaches such as migraine or tension headaches.

name: Isothipendyl
description: A first-generation phenothiazine antihistamine with anticholinergic and sedative properties, used for the symptomatic relief of allergic conditions.

name: Isradipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used to treat essential hypertension by relaxing vascular smooth muscle and decreasing peripheral vascular resistance.

name: Ivacaftor
description: A cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) potentiator used to improve CFTR protein function in patients with specific CFTR mutations causing cystic fibrosis.

name: Ixazomib
description: A reversible proteasome inhibitor used in combination with other agents for the treatment of multiple myeloma.

name: Josamycin
description: A macrolide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, effective against a range of Gram-positive and some Gram-negative bacteria.

name: Kaolin
description: A natural clay mineral used topically as a mild astringent and protectant, and orally as an adsorbent in antidiarrheal preparations.

name: Ketazolam
description: A benzodiazepine derivative with anxiolytic properties, primarily used for the short-term management of anxiety disorders.

name: Ketobemidone
description: A potent opioid analgesic primarily used for the treatment of severe acute and chronic pain.

name: Lanreotide
description: A somatostatin analog used to treat acromegaly and neuroendocrine tumors, by inhibiting the secretion of growth hormone and other peptides.

name: Lasofoxifene
description: A selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) developed for the prevention and treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis and for reducing the risk of invasive breast cancer.

name: Latamoxef
description: A beta-lactam antibiotic of the oxacephem class, used for treating a variety of bacterial infections, including those of the respiratory and urinary tracts.

name: Latanoprostene Bunod
description: A prostaglandin analog with a nitric oxide-donating component, used as an ophthalmic solution to reduce intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

name: Lesinurad
description: Lesinurad is a selective uric acid reabsorption inhibitor (SURI) used in combination with a xanthine oxidase inhibitor to treat hyperuricemia associated with gout.

name: Letermovir
description: Letermovir is an antiviral medication indicated for the prophylaxis of cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection and disease in adult CMV-seropositive recipients of an allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant.

name: Levacetylmethadol
description: Levacetylmethadol was an opioid analgesic previously used for the maintenance treatment of opioid dependence, owing to its long duration of action.

name: Levallorphan
description: Levallorphan is an opioid antagonist formerly used to reverse opioid-induced respiratory depression and as an adjunct in the treatment of opioid overdose.

name: Levobupivacaine
description: Levobupivacaine is a long-acting local anesthetic used for surgical anesthesia and for acute pain management via peripheral nerve blocks, epidural administration, or infiltration.

name: Levocabastine
description: A selective H1-receptor antagonist used topically to relieve symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis and allergic rhinitis.

name: Levocarnitine
description: An amino acid derivative used to treat primary and secondary carnitine deficiencies, facilitating the transport of long-chain fatty acids into mitochondria for energy production.

name: Levoleucovorin
description: The active L-isomer of leucovorin, used to diminish the toxicity of methotrexate and as a biochemical modulator to enhance the antitumor effects of fluorouracil.

name: Levomefolic Acid
description: The biologically active form of folate (L-5-methyltetrahydrofolate), used to treat folate deficiency and as a supplement where impaired folate metabolism exists.

name: Levomenol
description: A natural sesquiterpene alcohol, also known as bisabolol, used topically in cosmetics and skin care products for its anti-inflammatory and soothing properties.

name: Levonordefrin
description: A vasoconstrictor often co-administered with local anesthetics to prolong their duration of action and reduce systemic absorption, primarily used in dentistry.

name: Levorphanol
description: A potent synthetic opioid analgesic used for the management of moderate to severe acute and chronic pain.

name: Limaprost
description: A prostaglandin E1 derivative used to improve blood flow in peripheral circulatory disorders and to alleviate symptoms associated with lumbar spinal canal stenosis.

name: Liothyronine
description: A synthetic form of the thyroid hormone triiodothyronine (T3) used to treat hypothyroidism and in thyroid hormone replacement therapy.

name: Liotrix
description: A combination of synthetic levothyroxine (T4) and liothyronine (T3) in a 4:1 ratio, used for thyroid hormone replacement therapy in patients with hypothyroidism.

name: Lipoic Acid
description: An antioxidant used as an adjunct in the management of diabetic neuropathy symptoms.

name: Lisdexamfetamine
description: A prodrug of dextroamphetamine, a central nervous system stimulant used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and moderate to severe binge eating disorder.

name: Lisuride
description: A dopamine agonist used in the treatment of Parkinson's disease and hyperprolactinemia.

name: Lithium Cation
description: The active component of lithium salts, primarily used as a mood stabilizer in the treatment of bipolar disorder.

name: Lobeglitazone
description: A thiazolidinedione (TZD) class antidiabetic drug used to improve glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

name: Lodoxamide
description: A mast cell stabilizer used to prevent and treat allergic conjunctivitis, reducing symptoms like itching and redness.

name: Lofexidine
description: An alpha-2 adrenergic agonist used for the mitigation of opioid withdrawal symptoms during abrupt opioid discontinuation.

name: Lomitapide
description: A microsomal triglyceride transfer protein (MTP) inhibitor used as an adjunct to diet and other lipid-lowering therapies to reduce LDL-C in patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HoFH).

name: Lormetazepam
description: A short-acting benzodiazepine primarily used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.

name: Loteprednol
description: A corticosteroid used topically to treat inflammation of the eye, such as allergic conjunctivitis or post-operative inflammation and pain.

name: Loxoprofen
description: Loxoprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to alleviate pain and inflammation in conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and postoperative pain. It is also used for acute upper respiratory inflammation.

name: Lucanthone
description: Lucanthone is an antischistosomal agent that was historically used to treat infections caused by schistosomes. It has also been investigated for its potential as a radiosensitizer in cancer therapy.

name: Lumacaftor
description: Lumacaftor is a cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator (CFTR) corrector that, in combination with ivacaftor, improves the function of the CFTR protein in patients with specific homozygous F508del mutations, treating cystic fibrosis.

name: Lumiracoxib
description: Lumiracoxib was a selective cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) inhibitor, a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), used for the symptomatic treatment of osteoarthritis and acute pain before its withdrawal due to liver toxicity concerns.

name: Mafenide
description: Mafenide is a topical sulfonamide antibiotic primarily used in the form of a cream or solution to prevent and treat bacterial infections in second and third-degree burns.

name: Malathion
description: An organophosphate insecticide used topically to treat head lice and scabies by paralyzing and killing parasites.

name: Manidipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used to treat hypertension by relaxing blood vessels and reducing blood pressure.

name: Maprotiline
description: A tetracyclic antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder and anxiety associated with depression by inhibiting norepinephrine reuptake.

name: Masoprocol
description: A lipoxygenase inhibitor previously used topically to treat actinic keratoses by inhibiting cell proliferation.

name: Mecamylamine
description: A ganglionic blocker used to treat moderate to severe essential hypertension and malignant hypertension by reducing sympathetic nervous system activity.

name: Mechlorethamine
description: An alkylating agent used in the treatment of various lymphomas and as a topical agent for mycosis fungoides.

name: Meclofenamic Acid
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for the relief of mild to moderate pain, inflammation, and dysmenorrhea.

name: Medrogestone
description: A synthetic progestogen used in hormone replacement therapy and for managing conditions like dysfunctional uterine bleeding.

name: Medrysone
description: A topical corticosteroid primarily used in ophthalmology to reduce inflammation in various ocular conditions.

name: Megestrol Acetate
description: A synthetic progestin used as an appetite stimulant for cachexia in AIDS and cancer patients, and in the palliative treatment of advanced breast or endometrial cancer.

name: Melperone
description: An antipsychotic medication used to treat psychotic disorders, especially those involving agitation and sleep disturbances, with a lower risk of extrapyramidal side effects compared to some older antipsychotics.

name: Meperidine
description: An opioid analgesic used for the short-term relief of moderate to severe acute pain. It acts on opioid receptors in the central nervous system to reduce pain perception.

name: Mepivacaine
description: A local anesthetic used to provide regional anesthesia or nerve blocks for dental procedures, minor surgery, or pain management by temporarily blocking nerve impulse transmission.

name: Meprobamate
description: An anxiolytic and muscle relaxant previously used for the short-term treatment of anxiety disorders and insomnia. Its use has declined due to the availability of safer alternatives.

name: Mepyramine
description: An antihistamine primarily used topically or systemically to relieve symptoms of allergic reactions, such as itching, rash, and swelling associated with conditions like hay fever and insect bites.

name: Mequinol
description: A depigmenting agent used topically to lighten skin, particularly in the treatment of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation or solar lentigines.

name: Mequitazine
description: A non-sedating H1-receptor antagonist antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis and urticaria.

name: Mersalyl
description: A mercurial diuretic, historically used to reduce edema and fluid retention in conditions such as congestive heart failure or nephrotic syndrome. It is largely superseded by modern diuretics.

name: Mesoridazine
description: A phenothiazine antipsychotic, previously used for the management of schizophrenia. It was withdrawn due to a risk of serious cardiac arrhythmias.

name: Mestranol
description: A synthetic estrogen, formerly used as a component in oral contraceptive pills and in hormone replacement therapy for menopausal symptoms.

name: Metacycline
description: A tetracycline antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections, including respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, and acne.

name: Metamfetamine
description: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.

name: Metaraminol
description: An alpha-adrenergic agonist used as a vasopressor to treat hypotension, particularly during spinal anesthesia.

name: Methacholine
description: A cholinergic agonist primarily used in bronchial challenge tests to diagnose bronchial hyperreactivity, such as in asthma.

name: Methadone
description: A synthetic opioid used for the treatment of moderate to severe chronic pain and in medication-assisted treatment for opioid use disorder.

name: Methadyl Acetate
description: A long-acting synthetic opioid analgesic primarily used for the management of severe pain and historically in the treatment of opioid dependence.

name: Methantheline
description: An anticholinergic agent used to reduce gastrointestinal motility and secretions, and for its antispasmodic effects in conditions like peptic ulcer disease.

name: Methazolamide
description: A carbonic anhydrase inhibitor used to reduce intraocular pressure in the treatment of glaucoma by decreasing aqueous humor production.

name: Methenamine
description: A urinary antiseptic that is hydrolyzed in acidic urine to release formaldehyde, acting as a non-specific antibacterial agent for preventing recurrent urinary tract infections.

name: Methohexital
description: An ultra-short-acting barbiturate used intravenously for the rapid induction of general anesthesia and for short surgical procedures.

name: Methotrimeprazine
description: An antipsychotic and analgesic medication used to manage psychotic disorders, severe pain, and as a pre-anesthetic sedative.

name: Methoxamine
description: A vasopressor agent used to increase blood pressure by direct alpha-1 adrenergic agonism, typically to treat acute hypotension.

name: Methoxyflurane
description: An inhaled general anesthetic now primarily used for acute pain relief via self-administration for short-duration procedures or trauma.

name: Methscopolamine
description: An anticholinergic agent used to reduce gastrointestinal spasms, hypermotility, and acid secretion in conditions like peptic ulcer disease and irritable bowel syndrome.

name: Methscopolamine Bromide
description: The bromide salt of methscopolamine, used as an anticholinergic to decrease gastrointestinal motility and secretions for conditions like peptic ulcer and irritable bowel syndrome.

name: Methsuximide
description: An anticonvulsant used to treat absence seizures (petit mal epilepsy) that are refractory to other medications.

name: Methyclothiazide
description: A thiazide diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema associated with conditions such as congestive heart failure.

name: Methyl Aminolevulinate
description: A photosensitizer used topically in photodynamic therapy for treating actinic keratosis, superficial basal cell carcinoma, and Bowen's disease.

name: Methylnaltrexone
description: A peripherally acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist used to treat opioid-induced constipation in patients with advanced illness receiving palliative care.

name: Methylphenobarbital
description: A barbiturate anticonvulsant and sedative used in the treatment of various types of epilepsy and as a hypnotic.

name: Methyltestosterone
description: An androgen primarily used to treat male hypogonadism and certain types of breast cancer in women by replacing or antagonizing hormones.

name: Methyprylon
description: A sedative-hypnotic agent previously used for the short-term treatment of insomnia due to its central nervous system depressant effects.

name: Methysergide
description: An ergot alkaloid derivative used for the prophylactic treatment of severe, recurrent migraine and cluster headaches.

name: Meticillin
description: A beta-lactam antibiotic, a penicillinase-resistant penicillin, used to treat infections caused by susceptible Gram-positive bacteria, especially staphylococci.

name: Metipranolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenergic blocker used topically as an ophthalmic solution to reduce elevated intraocular pressure in open-angle glaucoma and ocular hypertension.

name: Metixene
description: An anticholinergic agent primarily used as an antiparkinsonian drug to reduce tremor and rigidity associated with Parkinson's disease.

name: Metocurine
description: A non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocker used as an adjunct to general anesthesia to induce skeletal muscle relaxation during surgery or mechanical ventilation.

name: Metrizamide
description: A non-ionic, water-soluble radiopaque contrast medium used for myelography and other neuroradiological procedures to visualize the subarachnoid space.

name: Metyrapone
description: An adrenocortical enzyme inhibitor (11-beta-hydroxylase inhibitor) used to diagnose pituitary adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) reserve and to treat Cushing's syndrome.

name: Metyrosine
description: A tyrosine hydroxylase inhibitor used to manage symptoms of pheochromocytoma by reducing the production of catecholamines.

name: Mezlocillin
description: A broad-spectrum penicillin antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, particularly those caused by susceptible Gram-negative organisms.

name: Midostaurin
description: A kinase inhibitor used to treat adults with newly diagnosed FLT3-mutated acute myeloid leukemia and advanced systemic mastocytosis.

name: Miglustat
description: An oral glucosylceramide synthase inhibitor used to treat mild to moderate type 1 Gaucher disease and Niemann-Pick disease type C.

name: Minaprine
description: A psychoactive agent previously investigated for its antidepressant and cognitive-enhancing properties, acting as a monoamine oxidase inhibitor.

name: Mipomersen
description: An antisense oligonucleotide used to reduce LDL-C, apoB, and non-HDL-C in patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia.

name: Mitiglinide
description: A rapid-acting insulin secretagogue used to lower postprandial blood glucose levels in patients with type 2 diabetes.

name: Mitotane
description: An adrenocorticolytic agent primarily used in the treatment of adrenocortical carcinoma.

name: Mivacurium
description: A short-acting neuromuscular blocking agent used as an adjunct to general anesthesia to facilitate tracheal intubation and skeletal muscle relaxation during surgery.

name: Moexipril
description: An ACE inhibitor used for the treatment of hypertension and symptomatic heart failure.

name: Molindone
description: An antipsychotic medication used for the management of schizophrenia.

name: Molsidomine
description: A vasodilator used to treat angina pectoris and chronic heart failure by reducing cardiac preload and afterload.

name: Moricizine
description: An antiarrhythmic agent (Class IC) used to treat ventricular arrhythmias by stabilizing cardiac cell membranes.

name: Morniflumate
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to alleviate pain and inflammation in conditions like osteoarthritis and soft tissue injuries.

name: Mycophenolic Acid
description: An immunosuppressant that inhibits inosine monophosphate dehydrogenase, primarily used to prevent organ rejection in transplant recipients.

name: Nabilone
description: A synthetic cannabinoid used as an antiemetic to treat severe nausea and vomiting induced by chemotherapy. It is also used to manage neuropathic pain.

name: Nadolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenergic blocker used to treat hypertension and angina pectoris, and for the long-term prophylaxis of migraine headaches.

name: Nafamostat
description: A synthetic serine protease inhibitor primarily used as an anticoagulant during hemodialysis and to treat acute pancreatitis.

name: Nafarelin
description: A gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonist used to treat endometriosis, central precocious puberty, and uterine fibroids.

name: Nafcillin
description: A penicillinase-resistant penicillin antibiotic used to treat serious staphylococcal infections, particularly those caused by penicillinase-producing Staphylococcus aureus.

name: Naftifine
description: An allylamine antifungal agent used topically to treat superficial fungal infections such as tinea pedis, tinea cruris, and tinea corporis.

name: Naldemedine
description: Naldemedine is a peripherally-acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist (PAMORA) used to treat opioid-induced constipation in adult patients with chronic non-cancer pain.

name: Naloxegol
description: Naloxegol is a peripherally-acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist (PAMORA) indicated for the treatment of opioid-induced constipation in adults with chronic non-cancer pain or cancer.

name: Nedaplatin
description: Nedaplatin is a platinum-based antineoplastic agent used in chemotherapy to treat various solid tumors, including head and neck cancers and non-small cell lung cancer.

name: Nefazodone
description: Nefazodone is an antidepressant that inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, primarily used for the treatment of major depressive disorder.

name: Nelarabine
description: Nelarabine is a purine nucleoside analog antimetabolite used as a chemotherapeutic agent for T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia and T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma.

name: Neratinib
description: A tyrosine kinase inhibitor used for the extended adjuvant treatment of early-stage HER2-positive breast cancer and for advanced or metastatic HER2-positive breast cancer.

name: Niacin
description: A vitamin B3 derivative used to treat dyslipidemia by lowering LDL-C and triglycerides, and to prevent and treat pellagra.

name: Nicardipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used to treat hypertension and chronic stable angina pectoris, often administered intravenously for acute blood pressure control.

name: Nilutamide
description: A non-steroidal antiandrogen used in the treatment of metastatic prostate cancer, typically in combination with surgical castration.

name: Nilvadipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used for the treatment of hypertension and in the management of cerebral ischemia.

name: Niraparib
description: A poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase (PARP) inhibitor used for the maintenance treatment of recurrent ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer. It is also indicated for HRD-positive advanced ovarian cancer.

name: Nisoldipine
description: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker used to treat hypertension by relaxing blood vessels and reducing the heart's workload.

name: Nitrofural
description: A topical antibacterial agent used to prevent and treat bacterial infections in superficial wounds, burns, and skin grafts.

name: Nitrous Acid
description: Nitrous acid itself is unstable; its salts (nitrites) are used medicinally, such as sodium nitrite as an antidote for cyanide poisoning or amyl nitrite for angina pectoris.

name: Nitrous Oxide
description: An inhaled gas used as a weak general anesthetic, often in combination with other agents, or as an analgesic for short painful procedures.

name: Nitroxoline
description: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial urinary tract infections (UTIs) caused by susceptible microorganisms.

name: Nomegestrol
description: A synthetic progestin used in hormonal contraception and for hormone replacement therapy.

name: Nonoxynol 9
description: A spermicide used for contraception to prevent pregnancy when applied intravaginally.

name: Norelgestromin
description: A synthetic progestin used in transdermal patches for hormonal contraception.

name: Norgestimate
description: A synthetic progestin used in combined oral contraceptives to prevent pregnancy.

name: Normethadone
description: An opioid analgesic, previously used for its pain-relieving properties.

name: Novobiocin
description: An antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, particularly those caused by Gram-positive bacteria, including resistant Staphylococcus strains.

name: Nylidrin
description: A peripheral vasodilator used to improve blood flow in conditions like peripheral vascular disease or other circulatory disorders.

name: Octreotide
description: A somatostatin analog used to treat acromegaly, neuroendocrine tumors (e.g., carcinoid syndrome), and esophageal variceal bleeding.

name: Olmesartan
description: An angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat hypertension (high blood pressure) and reduce the risk of cardiovascular events.

name: Olodaterol
description: Olodaterol is a long-acting beta2-adrenergic agonist (LABA) used for the long-term maintenance bronchodilator treatment of airflow obstruction in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Olsalazine
description: Olsalazine is an anti-inflammatory aminosalicylate primarily used to treat mild to moderate active ulcerative colitis and to maintain remission of ulcerative colitis.

name: Omacetaxine Mepesuccinate
description: Omacetaxine mepesuccinate is a protein synthesis inhibitor used for the treatment of adult patients with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) who are resistant or intolerant to two or more tyrosine kinase inhibitors.

name: Ombitasvir
description: Ombitasvir is a direct-acting antiviral medication that inhibits the hepatitis C virus (HCV) NS5A protein, used in combination with other agents for treating chronic HCV infection.

name: Oritavancin
description: Oritavancin is a lipoglycopeptide antibiotic used for the treatment of acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections (ABSSSI), including those caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA).

name: Orphenadrine
description: Orphenadrine is an anticholinergic agent used as a skeletal muscle relaxant to relieve pain associated with acute musculoskeletal conditions.

name: Oseltamivir
description: Oseltamivir is an antiviral drug used for the treatment and prevention of influenza A and B virus infections.

name: Ospemifene
description: Ospemifene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator used to treat moderate to severe dyspareunia caused by vulvar and vaginal atrophy in postmenopausal women.

name: Ouabain
description: Ouabain is a potent cardiac glycoside that inhibits the Na+/K+-ATPase pump, historically used to treat congestive heart failure and atrial arrhythmias.

name: Oxacillin
description: Oxacillin is a penicillinase-resistant beta-lactam antibiotic used to treat infections caused by penicillinase-producing Staphylococcus species.

name: Oxamniquine
description: An anthelmintic agent primarily used for the treatment of schistosomiasis caused by *Schistosoma mansoni*.

name: Oxandrolone
description: A synthetic anabolic-androgenic steroid used to promote weight gain, treat protein catabolism, and aid in recovery from severe burns or chronic infections.

name: Oxilofrine
description: A sympathomimetic amine that acts as an indirect adrenergic agonist, historically used as a stimulant and for orthostatic hypotension, though its clinical use is now limited due to regulatory restrictions.

name: Oxitriptan
description: A naturally occurring amino acid and serotonin precursor, used therapeutically to increase serotonin levels in conditions such as depression and fibromyalgia.

name: Oxprenolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenergic receptor blocker with intrinsic sympathomimetic activity (ISA), used in the management of hypertension, angina pectoris, and certain cardiac arrhythmias.

name: Oxtriphylline
description: A bronchodilator used to treat reversible airway obstruction in conditions like bronchial asthma, chronic bronchitis, and emphysema.

name: Oxybate
description: A central nervous system depressant used to treat cataplexy and excessive daytime sleepiness associated with narcolepsy.

name: Oxybuprocaine
description: A topical local anesthetic primarily used in ophthalmology for diagnostic procedures or minor surgical interventions on the eye.

name: Oxycodone
description: An opioid analgesic used to manage moderate to severe pain, available in immediate-release and extended-release formulations.

name: Oxymetholone
description: An anabolic steroid used to treat certain types of anemia, such as aplastic anemia, by stimulating red blood cell production.

name: Oxymorphone
description: A potent opioid analgesic used for the management of moderate to severe acute or chronic pain.

name: Palmitic Acid
description: A common saturated fatty acid found in animals and plants, often used as an excipient or a component in pharmaceutical formulations.

name: Pamidronic Acid
description: A bisphosphonate medication used to treat hypercalcemia of malignancy, Paget's disease of bone, and osteolytic bone metastases.

name: Panobinostat
description: A histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor used in combination with other agents for the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

name: Paraldehyde
description: A potent central nervous system depressant historically used as a sedative, hypnotic, and anticonvulsant, particularly for acute alcohol withdrawal and status epilepticus.

name: Paramethadione
description: An oxazolidinedione anticonvulsant used for the treatment of absence seizures (petit mal epilepsy), particularly in patients who have not responded to other therapies.

name: Paramethasone
description: A synthetic glucocorticoid corticosteroid used for its potent anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive properties in various conditions, including allergic reactions, rheumatic disorders, and skin diseases.

name: Pargyline
description: A non-selective, irreversible monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) that was historically used as an antihypertensive agent, particularly for moderate to severe hypertension.

name: Paricalcitol
description: A synthetic active vitamin D analog used to prevent and treat secondary hyperparathyroidism in patients with chronic kidney disease, both in non-dialysis and dialysis stages.

name: Paritaprevir
description: A direct-acting antiviral (DAA) that acts as an NS3/4A protease inhibitor, used in combination with other antiviral agents for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

name: Paromomycin
description: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat intestinal amebiasis and cryptosporidiosis by inhibiting protein synthesis in susceptible organisms.

name: Pasireotide
description: A somatostatin analog used to treat Cushing's disease and acromegaly by suppressing adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone secretion.

name: Pemirolast
description: A mast cell stabilizer used topically as an ophthalmic solution to prevent itching of the eyes due to allergic conjunctivitis.

name: Penbutolol
description: A non-selective beta-adrenergic blocker used to manage hypertension by reducing heart rate, cardiac output, and blood pressure.

name: Pentaerythritol Tetranitrate
description: A long-acting nitrate vasodilator used to prevent and reduce the frequency of angina pectoris attacks.

name: Pentamidine
description: An antimicrobial agent primarily used for the treatment and prophylaxis of Pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP) and for treating African trypanosomiasis (sleeping sickness).

name: Pentobarbital
description: A short-acting barbiturate used as a sedative-hypnotic for short-term insomnia, pre-anesthetic medication, and in the control of acute convulsive episodes.

name: Pentolinium
description: A ganglionic blocking agent that was historically used as an antihypertensive medication, although it is now largely obsolete due to its side effect profile.

name: Pentostatin
description: A purine analog antineoplastic agent used in the treatment of hairy cell leukemia and certain other lymphoproliferative disorders by inhibiting adenosine deaminase.

name: Perflutren
description: An ultrasound contrast agent used to enhance the delineation of the left ventricular endocardial border and opacification of the left ventricular chamber during echocardiography.

name: Pergolide
description: A dopamine receptor agonist used to treat symptoms of Parkinson's disease.

name: Perhexiline
description: An antianginal agent used to treat severe stable angina pectoris, particularly when other treatments are ineffective.

name: Periciazine
description: A phenothiazine antipsychotic used in the management of schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders.

name: Perindopril
description: An ACE inhibitor used to treat hypertension, heart failure, and to reduce cardiovascular events in patients with stable coronary artery disease.

name: Perospirone
description: An atypical antipsychotic used in the treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Perphenazine
description: A phenothiazine antipsychotic used to treat psychotic disorders like schizophrenia and for the short-term management of severe nausea and vomiting.

name: Phenacemide
description: An anticonvulsant reserved for the treatment of refractory complex partial seizures and other seizure disorders unresponsive to safer medications.

name: Phendimetrazine
description: A sympathomimetic amine used as an anorectic for short-term management of exogenous obesity, typically in conjunction with diet and exercise.

name: Phenelzine
description: A monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) antidepressant used for the treatment of atypical depression and other mood disorders unresponsive to alternative therapies.

name: Phenindamine
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic reactions such as sneezing, runny nose, itchy eyes, and skin rashes.

name: Phenmetrazine
description: A stimulant drug that was historically used as an anorectic for weight loss due to its appetite-suppressing effects.

name: Phenobarbital
description: A barbiturate anticonvulsant and sedative used to treat various types of seizures, particularly tonic-clonic and focal seizures, and as a short-term sedative.

name: Phenoxymethylpenicillin
description: An oral penicillin antibiotic effective against a range of gram-positive bacteria, commonly used to treat bacterial infections such as strep throat, otitis media, and skin infections.

name: Phenprocoumon
description: A vitamin K antagonist oral anticoagulant used to prevent and treat thromboembolic disorders, such as deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.

name: Phensuximide
description: A succinimide anticonvulsant primarily used in the treatment of absence seizures (petit mal epilepsy).

name: Phentermine
description: An anorectic agent used for short-term weight management in conjunction with diet and exercise, acting as a central nervous system stimulant to suppress appetite.

name: Phentolamine
description: An alpha-adrenergic antagonist used to reverse the effects of alpha-agonists, manage hypertensive crises, and treat extravasation of vasopressors.

name: Phenylacetic Acid
description: A metabolite whose derivatives, such as sodium phenylacetate, are used to promote ammonia excretion in the treatment of hyperammonemia, particularly in urea cycle disorders.

name: Phenylbutazone
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) primarily used in veterinary medicine for its analgesic and anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Phenylbutyric Acid
description: An ammonia scavenger used in the treatment of urea cycle disorders to reduce elevated ammonia levels in the blood.

name: Phosphate, Monobasic
description: Used as a source of phosphate for electrolyte replacement or in formulations for bowel cleansing before medical procedures.

name: Phylloquinone
description: A form of Vitamin K (K1) essential for blood coagulation and used to treat or prevent bleeding due to vitamin K deficiency or anticoagulant overdose.

name: Physostigmine
description: A reversible cholinesterase inhibitor used to reverse the central and peripheral anticholinergic effects of tricyclic antidepressant overdose or other anticholinergic poisoning.

name: Pibrentasvir
description: A direct-acting antiviral agent, specifically an NS5A inhibitor, used in combination with other antivirals for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus infection.

name: Picosulfuric Acid
description: A stimulant laxative used to treat constipation or for bowel preparation before colonoscopy or other medical procedures.

name: Pimavanserin
description: Pimavanserin is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat hallucinations and delusions associated with Parkinson's disease psychosis.

name: Pinaverium
description: Pinaverium is an antispasmodic agent used to relieve pain and discomfort associated with functional bowel disorders, such as irritable bowel syndrome.

name: Pipamperone
description: Pipamperone is a butyrophenone antipsychotic primarily used to manage psychotic disorders, especially those associated with agitation and aggression.

name: Pipazethate
description: Pipazethate is a non-narcotic antitussive agent used to relieve persistent cough by acting on the central nervous system to suppress the cough reflex.

name: Pipecuronium
description: Pipecuronium is a non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocker used as an adjunct to general anesthesia to induce skeletal muscle relaxation during surgery or mechanical ventilation.

name: Pipobroman
description: An alkylating antineoplastic agent used in the treatment of polycythemia vera and chronic myelogenous leukemia.

name: Pipotiazine
description: A long-acting phenothiazine antipsychotic used for the management of chronic psychotic disorders, such as schizophrenia.

name: Pirbuterol
description: A short-acting beta-2 adrenergic agonist used as a bronchodilator for the treatment and prevention of bronchospasm in reversible obstructive airway disease.

name: Pirenzepine
description: A selective muscarinic M1 receptor antagonist that reduces gastric acid secretion, used in the treatment of peptic ulcers.

name: Pirlindole
description: A tetracyclic antidepressant and reversible monoamine oxidase A inhibitor used in the treatment of various depressive disorders.

name: Pivampicillin
description: An oral prodrug of ampicillin, used as a broad-spectrum penicillin antibiotic to treat various bacterial infections, particularly respiratory and urinary tract infections.

name: Pivmecillinam
description: An oral prodrug of mecillinam, a beta-lactam antibiotic primarily used for the treatment of uncomplicated urinary tract infections due to its activity against Gram-negative bacteria.

name: Pixantrone
description: An anthracenedione derivative used as an antineoplastic agent for the treatment of relapsed or refractory aggressive B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

name: Plicamycin
description: An antineoplastic antibiotic historically used to treat testicular carcinoma and to manage hypercalcemia and hypercalciuria associated with advanced malignancy.

name: Podofilox
description: A topical antimitotic agent derived from podophyllotoxin, used for the treatment of external genital and perianal warts (condyloma acuminata).

name: Podophyllin
description: Podophyllin is a topical antimitotic agent used for the treatment of external genital and perianal warts (condylomata acuminata).

name: Polaprezinc
description: Polaprezinc is a zinc-L-carnosine complex used to treat gastric ulcers by promoting mucosal protection, repair, and exhibiting anti-inflammatory effects.

name: Polythiazide
description: Polythiazide is a thiazide diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema by increasing the excretion of sodium, chloride, and water.

name: Ponatinib
description: Ponatinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor used to treat chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and Philadelphia chromosome-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia (Ph+ ALL) resistant to other therapies.

name: Practolol
description: Practolol was a cardioselective beta-adrenergic blocker previously used to treat cardiac arrhythmias and angina pectoris.

name: Pralatrexate
description: An antifolate antineoplastic agent used to treat relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma by inhibiting dihydrofolate reductase and other folate-dependent enzymes.

name: Pramocaine
