description: A topical local anesthetic used to relieve pain and itching from skin conditions, insect bites, and hemorrhoids by blocking nerve impulses in the skin.

name: Pranlukast
description: A leukotriene receptor antagonist used in the management of bronchial asthma and allergic rhinitis by inhibiting the inflammatory effects of leukotrienes.

name: Prasterone
description: A synthetic form of DHEA, used as a vaginal insert to treat moderate to severe dyspareunia due to vulvar and vaginal atrophy in postmenopausal women.

name: Prazepam
description: A long-acting benzodiazepine used for the short-term treatment of anxiety disorders by enhancing the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the central nervous system.

name: Prednisone
description: A corticosteroid primarily used for its anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effects in treating various allergic, inflammatory, and autoimmune disorders.

name: Probucol
description: An antioxidant and lipid-lowering agent previously used to decrease serum cholesterol levels, particularly low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol.

name: Procainamide
description: A Class IA antiarrhythmic agent used to treat various ventricular and supraventricular tachyarrhythmias by blocking sodium channels in the heart.

name: Procaine Benzylpenicillin
description: A combination of penicillin G and procaine, used as a long-acting intramuscular antibiotic to treat various bacterial infections susceptible to penicillin. The procaine component reduces injection pain.

name: Procaterol
description: A short-acting beta-2 adrenergic agonist used as a bronchodilator to relieve bronchospasm associated with asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

name: Profenamine
description: An antihistamine with anticholinergic and antiparkinsonian properties, primarily used to manage symptoms of Parkinson's disease and drug-induced parkinsonism.

name: Progabide
description: A GABA receptor agonist used as an antiepileptic drug to treat various forms of epilepsy by increasing GABAergic neurotransmission.

name: Promazine
description: A phenothiazine antipsychotic used for the management of psychotic disorders like schizophrenia and for the short-term control of severe agitated states.

name: Propacetamol
description: A prodrug of paracetamol, administered intravenously for rapid onset relief of pain and fever, especially when oral administration is not possible.

name: Propantheline
description: An anticholinergic and antispasmodic agent used to reduce gastric acid secretion, hypermotility, and spasm in conditions such as peptic ulcer disease and irritable bowel syndrome.

name: Propiverine
description: An anticholinergic and antispasmodic agent used to treat symptoms of overactive bladder, such as urinary frequency, urgency, and incontinence.

name: Propoxycaine
description: A local anesthetic of the ester type, primarily used for infiltration and nerve block anesthesia, often in dental procedures.

name: Propylthiouracil
description: An antithyroid agent used to treat hyperthyroidism by inhibiting the synthesis of thyroid hormones.

name: Protocatechualdehyde
description: A phenolic aldehyde found in various plants, investigated for its antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and potential anticancer properties.

name: Protriptyline
description: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used in the treatment of depression and sometimes for narcolepsy due to its stimulating effects.

name: Pyrantel
description: An anthelmintic drug used to treat parasitic worm infections, including pinworms, roundworms, and hookworms.

name: Pyrvinium
description: An anthelmintic agent used primarily for the treatment of enterobiasis, commonly known as pinworm infection.

name: Quazepam
description: A benzodiazepine hypnotic used for the short-term treatment of insomnia, aiding in sleep initiation and maintenance.

name: Quinacrine
description: An antimalarial drug, also used as an anthelmintic for giardiasis and as a sclerosing agent for various medical procedures.

name: Quinagolide
description: A dopamine D2 receptor agonist used to reduce elevated prolactin levels in patients with hyperprolactinemia.

name: Quinestrol
description: A long-acting estrogen used in hormone replacement therapy for menopausal symptoms or estrogen deficiency conditions.

name: Quinethazone
description: A thiazide-like diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema associated with conditions like congestive heart failure.

name: Quinupristin
description: A streptogramin antibiotic used in combination with dalfopristin to treat serious infections caused by multidrug-resistant Gram-positive bacteria, such as vancomycin-resistant *Enterococcus faecium*.

name: Radium Ra Dichloride
description: A radiopharmaceutical alpha-emitting radionuclide used for the treatment of castration-resistant prostate cancer with symptomatic bone metastases.

name: Raltitrexed
description: An antimetabolite chemotherapy agent that inhibits thymidylate synthase, used in the treatment of advanced colorectal cancer.

name: Regadenoson
description: Regadenoson is an adenosine A2A receptor agonist used as a pharmacologic stress agent for myocardial perfusion imaging in patients unable to undergo exercise stress.

name: Remifentanil
description: Remifentanil is an ultra-short-acting synthetic opioid analgesic used for maintaining anesthesia during surgery and for short-term pain management.

name: Remikiren
description: Remikiren is a direct renin inhibitor that was investigated for the treatment of hypertension, but its development was discontinued due to efficacy concerns.

name: Remoxipride
description: Remoxipride is an atypical antipsychotic agent, acting as a dopamine D2 receptor antagonist, used in the treatment of schizophrenia.

name: Rescinnamine
description: Rescinnamine is a rauwolfia alkaloid with antihypertensive and tranquilizing properties, used to treat mild to moderate hypertension and as a sedative.

name: Ribostamycin
description: Ribostamycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic primarily used to treat bacterial infections, effective against a range of gram-negative and some gram-positive bacteria.

name: Ridogrel
description: Ridogrel is an antithrombotic agent that inhibits thromboxane synthase and antagonizes thromboxane A2 receptors, reducing platelet aggregation and vasoconstriction.

name: Rifapentine
description: Rifapentine is a rifamycin antibiotic used for the treatment of tuberculosis, especially in regimens designed for shorter treatment durations.

name: Rilpivirine
description: Rilpivirine is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) used in combination with other antiretroviral agents to treat human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) infection.

name: Rimexolone
description: Rimexolone is a corticosteroid used topically to reduce inflammation and pain associated with ocular conditions, such as post-operative inflammation or allergic conjunctivitis.

name: Risedronic Acid
description: A bisphosphonate medication used to treat and prevent osteoporosis in postmenopausal women and men, and for the treatment of Paget's disease of bone.

name: Rolapitant
description: A neurokinin-1 (NK-1) receptor antagonist used in combination with other antiemetics to prevent delayed nausea and vomiting associated with emetogenic chemotherapy.

name: Rolitetracycline
description: An injectable broad-spectrum tetracycline antibiotic, used to treat various bacterial infections, particularly when oral administration is not feasible.

name: Romidepsin
description: A histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor used for the treatment of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL) and peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL).

name: Rosoxacin
description: A quinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, primarily those of the urinary tract.

name: Rotigotine
description: A non-ergoline dopamine agonist used in the management of Parkinson's disease and moderate-to-severe primary restless legs syndrome.

name: Roxatidine Acetate
description: A histamine H2 receptor antagonist used to reduce gastric acid secretion, primarily for the treatment of peptic ulcers and reflux esophagitis.

name: Rufinamide
description: An antiepileptic drug used as an adjunctive treatment for seizures associated with Lennox-Gastaut syndrome in adults and children.

name: Salicylamide
description: An analgesic and antipyretic agent, derived from salicylic acid, used for the temporary relief of mild to moderate pain and fever.

name: Salicylate
description: Refers to salts or esters of salicylic acid, widely used for their analgesic, antipyretic, and anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Salsalate
description: A non-acetylated salicylate used as an anti-inflammatory and analgesic for pain and inflammation associated with conditions like rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.

name: Sapropterin
description: A synthetic form of tetrahydrobiopterin (BH4) used to reduce phenylalanine levels in patients with hyperphenylalaninemia due to Phenylketonuria (PKU) or BH4 deficiency who are BH4-responsive.

name: Scopolamine
description: An anticholinergic medication primarily used to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with motion sickness and post-operative recovery, and also to reduce secretions pre-operatively.

name: Secobarbital
description: A short-acting barbiturate with sedative-hypnotic effects, historically used for the short-term treatment of insomnia and as a pre-operative sedative.

name: Sibutramine
description: An oral anorexiant previously used for weight loss in obese patients by promoting satiety, but was withdrawn from the market due to cardiovascular risks.

name: Simeprevir
description: An NS3/4A protease inhibitor used in combination with other antiviral agents for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

name: Sitaxentan
description: An endothelin receptor antagonist previously used for the treatment of pulmonary hypertension, but voluntarily withdrawn due to liver toxicity concerns.

name: Sonidegib
description: A Hedgehog pathway inhibitor used for the treatment of adult patients with locally advanced basal cell carcinoma.

name: Spectinomycin
description: An aminocyclitol antibiotic used for the treatment of uncomplicated gonorrhea, particularly in patients allergic to beta-lactam antibiotics.

name: Spirapril
description: An angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor used for the treatment of hypertension and congestive heart failure.

name: Stepronin
description: Stepronin is a mucolytic agent used to reduce the viscosity of respiratory secretions, facilitating their expectoration in conditions such as chronic bronchitis.

name: Stiripentol
description: Stiripentol is an anticonvulsant used as an add-on therapy for refractory generalized tonic-clonic seizures in patients with severe myoclonic epilepsy in infancy (Dravet syndrome).

name: Streptozocin
description: Streptozocin is an alkylating antineoplastic agent specifically used in the treatment of metastatic islet cell carcinoma of the pancreas.

name: Succinylcholine
description: Succinylcholine is a depolarizing neuromuscular blocker that causes skeletal muscle relaxation and paralysis, primarily used for short-term muscle relaxation to facilitate tracheal intubation.

name: Sufentanil
description: Sufentanil is a potent synthetic opioid analgesic primarily used for intravenous analgesia during surgery and for the management of severe acute pain.

name: Sulconazole
description: An antifungal agent applied topically to treat superficial fungal skin infections such as tinea pedis, cruris, and corporis.

name: Sulfacetamide
description: A topical sulfonamide antibiotic primarily used for ophthalmic bacterial infections and dermatological conditions like acne vulgaris.

name: Sulfacytine
description: A short-acting oral sulfonamide antibiotic, formerly used for the treatment of acute urinary tract infections.

name: Sulfadimethoxine
description: A long-acting sulfonamide antibiotic, historically used for treating bacterial infections, including respiratory and urinary tract infections, and now mainly in veterinary medicine.

name: Sulfadoxine
description: A long-acting sulfonamide antibiotic often combined with pyrimethamine to treat uncomplicated malaria and for malaria prophylaxis.

name: Sulfamerazine
description: A sulfonamide antibiotic used for treating various bacterial infections, including urinary tract infections, respiratory tract infections, and meningitis.

name: Sulfamethazine
description: A sulfonamide antibiotic effective against a broad spectrum of gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, primarily used in veterinary medicine for treating bacterial infections.

name: Sulfamethizole
description: A short-acting sulfonamide antibiotic primarily used for the treatment of acute uncomplicated urinary tract infections.

name: Sulfametopyrazine
description: A long-acting sulfonamide antibiotic, often used in combination with other antimalarials like pyrimethamine for the treatment of malaria.

name: Sulfamoxole
description: A sulfonamide antibiotic used for treating bacterial infections, including urinary and respiratory tract infections.

name: Sulfanilamide
description: An antibacterial sulfonamide that inhibits bacterial folic acid synthesis, used to treat various bacterial infections.

name: Sulfaphenazole
description: A long-acting sulfonamide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections by inhibiting bacterial dihydrofolate synthesis.

name: Sulfapyridine
description: A sulfonamide primarily used for its anti-inflammatory properties in the treatment of dermatological conditions like dermatitis herpetiformis.

name: Sulfate
description: A common counter-ion used in many drug formulations to form stable salts. Certain sulfate salts, like magnesium sulfate, are used as laxatives.

name: Sulfathiazole
description: A short-acting sulfonamide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, inhibiting bacterial folate synthesis.

name: Sulfinpyrazone
description: A uricosuric agent used to treat chronic gout by increasing the excretion of uric acid, thereby reducing serum urate levels.

name: Sulfisoxazole
description: A sulfonamide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, particularly those affecting the urinary tract, and certain ear and respiratory infections.

name: Sulindac
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, inflammation, and stiffness associated with conditions like arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis.

name: Suprofen
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) previously used topically in ophthalmic solutions to inhibit intraoperative miosis during cataract surgery.

name: Suramin
description: An antiparasitic medication primarily used in the treatment of early-stage African trypanosomiasis (sleeping sickness) and onchocerciasis.

name: Suvorexant
description: Suvorexant is an orexin receptor antagonist used to treat insomnia characterized by difficulties with sleep onset and/or sleep maintenance. It works by blocking the binding of wake-promoting orexin neuropeptides.

name: Talniflumate
description: Talniflumate is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) and a prodrug of niflumic acid, primarily used for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties to relieve pain and inflammation.

name: Tasimelteon
description: Tasimelteon is a melatonin receptor agonist indicated for the treatment of non-24-hour sleep-wake disorder (Non-24) in totally blind individuals. It helps to regulate the circadian rhythm.

name: Tasosartan
description: Tasosartan is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) intended for the treatment of hypertension. It works by blocking the vasoconstrictor and aldosterone-secreting effects of angiotensin II.

name: Tavaborole
description: Tavaborole is an oxaborole antifungal agent indicated for the topical treatment of onychomycosis of the toenails. It inhibits fungal leucyl-tRNA synthetase.

name: Technetium Tc 99m Mebrofenin
description: A radiopharmaceutical used in diagnostic imaging for hepatobiliary studies to assess liver function and bile duct patency.

name: Technetium Tc 99m Medronate
description: A radiopharmaceutical used in diagnostic imaging for bone scintigraphy to detect areas of increased osteoblastic activity, such as in bone metastases or fractures.

name: Technetium Tc 99m Sestamibi
description: A radiopharmaceutical used in diagnostic imaging for myocardial perfusion studies to assess cardiac function and for parathyroid gland localization.

name: Tedizolid Phosphate
description: An oxazolidinone class antibiotic, administered as a prodrug, used for the treatment of acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections (ABSSSI).

name: Telaprevir
description: A direct-acting antiviral (DAA) medication, specifically a hepatitis C virus (HCV) NS3/4A protease inhibitor, used in combination therapy for chronic hepatitis C infection.

name: Telavancin
description: A lipoglycopeptide antibiotic used to treat complicated skin and skin structure infections and hospital-acquired bacterial pneumonia caused by susceptible Gram-positive bacteria, including MRSA.

name: Telithromycin
description: A ketolide antibiotic historically used for community-acquired pneumonia, though its use is now highly restricted due to potential for severe hepatotoxicity.

name: Temazepam
description: A benzodiazepine used for the short-term treatment of insomnia by inducing sleep and reducing nocturnal awakenings.

name: Temoporfin
description: A photosensitizer used in photodynamic therapy for the treatment of advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, activated by specific wavelengths of light.

name: Teniposide
description: A topoisomerase II inhibitor antineoplastic agent used in combination chemotherapy for the treatment of refractory childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia and other cancers.

name: Tenofovir Disoproxil
description: An antiretroviral medication used for the treatment of HIV-1 infection and chronic hepatitis B virus infection. It acts as a nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitor.

name: Terconazole
description: An azole antifungal agent primarily used for the local treatment of vulvovaginal candidiasis, commonly known as vaginal yeast infections.

name: Tesamorelin
description: A synthetic growth hormone-releasing factor analog used to reduce excess abdominal visceral fat in HIV-infected patients with lipodystrophy.

name: Testolactone
description: An aromatase inhibitor used as an antineoplastic agent in the palliative treatment of advanced breast cancer in postmenopausal women.

name: Tetryzoline
description: An alpha-adrenergic agonist used topically as a decongestant to relieve redness of the eyes caused by minor irritations and for nasal congestion.

name: Theobromine
description: A methylxanthine alkaloid that acts as a weak diuretic, vasodilator, and cardiac stimulant. It also exhibits bronchodilator properties.

name: Thiabendazole
description: An anthelmintic medication used to treat infections caused by various parasitic worms, including strongyloidiasis, cutaneous larva migrans, and trichinosis.

name: Thiamylal
description: An ultra-short-acting barbiturate anesthetic used for induction and maintenance of general anesthesia, or for short surgical procedures.

name: Thioproperazine
description: A potent phenothiazine antipsychotic medication used to manage severe mental disorders, particularly schizophrenia, due to its strong dopamine receptor blockade.

name: Thiosulfuric Acid
description: An unstable inorganic acid whose stable salts, such as sodium thiosulfate, are used medicinally as an antidote for cyanide poisoning and topically for fungal skin infections.

name: Thiothixene
description: An antipsychotic medication primarily used to treat schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders by altering brain chemical activity.

name: Thonzylamine
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms associated with allergies, such as sneezing, runny nose, and itching.

name: Thymol
description: A phenolic compound with antiseptic and antifungal properties, used in some mouthwashes and topical treatments for skin infections.

name: Tiaprofenic Acid
description: A non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for the relief of pain and inflammation in conditions like osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.

name: Tiludronic Acid
description: A bisphosphonate medication used in the treatment of Paget's disease of bone to normalize bone turnover and reduce bone pain.

name: Tioguanine
description: Tioguanine is a purine analogue antimetabolite used as a chemotherapeutic agent in the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia (AML).

name: Tipranavir
description: Tipranavir is a non-peptidic protease inhibitor used in combination with ritonavir to treat HIV-1 infection in treatment-experienced adults.

name: Titanium Dioxide
description: Titanium dioxide is an inert inorganic compound primarily used as an opacifying agent, pigment, and UV-blocking agent in sunscreens and various pharmaceutical formulations.

name: Tixocortol
description: Tixocortol is a synthetic corticosteroid used topically for its anti-inflammatory and anti-allergic properties, particularly in treating inflammatory skin conditions.

name: Tolazamide
description: Tolazamide is an oral sulfonylurea antidiabetic agent used to lower blood glucose levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus by stimulating insulin release from the pancreas.

name: Tolazoline
description: An alpha-adrenergic antagonist used as a vasodilator to treat persistent pulmonary hypertension of the newborn (PPHN).

name: Tolcapone
description: A COMT inhibitor used as an adjunct to levodopa/carbidopa for the treatment of Parkinson's disease to extend levodopa's effects.

name: Toloxatone
description: A reversible MAO-A inhibitor that was investigated as an antidepressant.

name: Toremifene
description: A selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) used in the treatment of metastatic breast cancer in postmenopausal women.

name: Trandolapril
description: An ACE inhibitor used for treating hypertension, congestive heart failure, and to improve survival post-myocardial infarction.

name: Tranilast
description: An antiallergic agent used to treat bronchial asthma, allergic rhinitis, and keloids/hypertrophic scars by inhibiting mediator release and fibroblast proliferation.

name: Trapidil
description: A platelet-derived growth factor receptor antagonist and phosphodiesterase inhibitor used in the treatment of atherosclerosis and post-angioplasty restenosis.

name: Treprostinil
description: A prostacyclin analog used to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) by causing vasodilation and inhibiting platelet aggregation, improving exercise capacity.

name: Triazolam
description: A short-acting benzodiazepine used for the short-term treatment of insomnia due to its potent sedative and hypnotic effects.

name: Trichlormethiazide
description: A thiazide diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema by promoting the excretion of sodium, chloride, and water.

name: Trichloroethylene
description: Historically used as an inhaled general anesthetic and analgesic for short procedures and childbirth due to its central nervous system depressant properties.

name: Triethylenetetramine
description: A copper-chelating agent used orally to treat Wilson's disease in patients intolerant to D-penicillamine, by reducing copper levels in the body.

name: Triflupromazine
description: A phenothiazine antipsychotic used to treat psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia, acting as a dopamine receptor antagonist in the brain.

name: Triflusal
description: An antiplatelet agent used to prevent thrombotic events, such as stroke or myocardial infarction, by inhibiting platelet aggregation.

name: Trilostane
description: An adrenal steroid synthesis inhibitor used to treat Cushing's syndrome by reducing the production of cortisol and other adrenal steroids.

name: Trimethadione
description: An oxazolidinedione anticonvulsant used primarily for the treatment of absence seizures (petit mal epilepsy) that are refractory to other medications.

name: Trimethaphan
description: A short-acting ganglionic blocking agent administered intravenously to induce controlled hypotension during surgery and for the treatment of hypertensive emergencies.

name: Trimethobenzamide
description: An antiemetic agent used to prevent or reduce nausea and vomiting, particularly post-operative or associated with gastroenteritis.

name: Trimetrexate
description: A dihydrofolate reductase inhibitor used as an alternative therapy for moderate-to-severe Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia (PCP) in immunocompromised patients intolerant to standard treatments.

name: Trioxsalen
description: A psoralen derivative used as a photosensitizer in combination with ultraviolet A (UVA) light (PUVA therapy) for the repigmentation of vitiligo and treatment of psoriasis.

name: Tripelennamine
description: An antihistamine used to relieve symptoms associated with seasonal and perennial allergic rhinitis, such as sneezing, runny nose, and itching of the nose or throat.

name: Trolamine
description: An organic amine commonly used as an emulsifying agent, pH adjuster, and solubilizer in pharmaceutical and cosmetic topical formulations.

name: Trolamine Salicylate
description: A topical analgesic used for the temporary relief of minor aches and pains of muscles and joints associated with conditions like arthritis, backache, strains, and sprains.

name: Troleandomycin
description: A macrolide antibiotic previously used to treat certain bacterial infections, though its current clinical use is limited due to drug interactions and hepatotoxicity.

name: Tromethamine
description: An organic amine proton acceptor used to prevent or correct metabolic acidosis, often administered intravenously to increase blood pH.

name: Tropisetron
description: A selective 5-HT3 receptor antagonist used to prevent and treat chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV) and postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV).

name: Trovafloxacin
description: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, though its use has been restricted due to concerns about severe hepatotoxicity.

name: Tryptophan
description: An essential amino acid and a precursor for the biosynthesis of serotonin, melatonin, and niacin, often used as a dietary supplement to support mood and sleep.

name: Tubocurarine
description: A non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent historically used to induce muscle relaxation during surgical procedures and to facilitate mechanical ventilation.

name: Ubidecarenone
description: Also known as Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10), it is an antioxidant and plays a vital role in cellular energy production, often used as a dietary supplement for cardiovascular health and energy support.

name: Ulipristal
description: A selective progesterone receptor modulator used as emergency contraception and for pre-operative treatment of uterine fibroids.

name: Ulobetasol
description: A potent topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation and itching in corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses.

name: Unoprostone
description: An ophthalmic solution used to lower elevated intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.

name: Uracil Mustard
description: An alkylating agent historically used as an antineoplastic for certain leukemias and lymphomas.

name: Valaciclovir
description: An antiviral prodrug of acyclovir used to treat herpes simplex (e.g., cold sores, genital herpes) and herpes zoster (shingles) infections.

name: Valbenazine
description: Valbenazine is a selective vesicular monoamine transporter 2 (VMAT2) inhibitor used to treat tardive dyskinesia in adults.

name: Valrubicin
description: Valrubicin is an anthracycline antibiotic indicated for intravesical therapy of BCG-refractory carcinoma in situ of the urinary bladder.

name: Vapreotide
description: Vapreotide is a synthetic somatostatin analog used to manage acute variceal bleeding and symptoms associated with neuroendocrine tumors.

name: Vemurafenib
description: Vemurafenib is a BRAF kinase inhibitor used to treat unresectable or metastatic melanoma with a BRAF V600E mutation.

name: Venetoclax
description: Venetoclax is a BCL-2 inhibitor used to treat chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL), and acute myeloid leukemia (AML).

name: Vernakalant
description: An antiarrhythmic agent used for the rapid conversion of recent onset atrial fibrillation to sinus rhythm.

name: Viloxazine
description: A selective norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) primarily used in the treatment of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

name: Vindesine
description: A vinca alkaloid antineoplastic agent used in the treatment of various cancers, including acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

name: Vinflunine
description: A fluorinated vinca alkaloid antineoplastic agent used for advanced or metastatic transitional cell carcinoma of the urothelial tract.

name: Viomycin
description: An older antitubercular antibiotic used as a second-line agent for the treatment of multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

name: Vismodegib
description: A Hedgehog pathway inhibitor used for the treatment of adults with advanced basal cell carcinoma.

name: Vorapaxar
description: An antiplatelet medication that is a PAR-1 antagonist, used to reduce the risk of thrombotic cardiovascular events in patients with a history of myocardial infarction or peripheral arterial disease.

name: Vorinostat
description: A histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor used for the treatment of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL) in patients with progressive, persistent, or recurrent disease.

name: Voxilaprevir
description: An NS3/4A protease inhibitor used in combination with sofosbuvir and velpatasvir for the retreatment of chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.

name: Ximelagatran
description: An oral direct thrombin inhibitor that was developed as an anticoagulant to prevent and treat venous thromboembolism and for stroke prevention in atrial fibrillation, but was withdrawn due to hepatotoxicity.

name: Yohimbine
description: An alpha-2 adrenergic antagonist that has been explored for the treatment of erectile dysfunction and orthostatic hypotension.

name: Zalcitabine
description: A nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI) used in combination regimens for the treatment of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) infection.

name: Zucapsaicin
description: A synthetic capsaicin analog used topically to relieve neuropathic pain, such as postherpetic neuralgia or diabetic neuropathy.
